revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-21 19:40:23.000000000', 'message': "Update .zuul.yaml

Rename jobs to follow naming conventions for a shared global namespace,
see
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#consistent-naming-for-jobs-with-zuul-v3

Also, remove name from project stanza, it's not needed for in-tree zuul
files anymore.

Change-Id: Id58a3114a613a5bbca914254cc09cbbbd10913bc
"}]
commit_message:
Update .zuul.yaml

Rename jobs to follow naming conventions for a shared global namespace,
see
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#consistent-naming-for-jobs-with-zuul-v3

Also, remove name from project stanza, it's not needed for in-tree zuul
files anymore.

Change-Id: Id58a3114a613a5bbca914254cc09cbbbd10913bc

commit_message:
use EGRESS_DIRECTION and INGRESS_DIRECTION from neutron-lib

The EGRESS_DIRECTION and INGRESS_DIRECTION constants live in neutron-lib
now and neutron is going to consume them in
I1b81f5c3de9e6f2c0967c2db23ddb716ee7ec6b9

This patch switches the code over to use neutron-lib's version of the
constants.

Change-Id: I00cb1d653a8d11d52df9d999c588ded81c34f28a

commit_message:
Improve exception message in network related Batch/DeleteAction

DeleteActiona and BatchAction in the network, subnet and router tables
are improved using handle_exception_with_detail_message decorator.

There is no need to have separate delete action in the admin network
and subnet tables now, so they are merged into the corresponding delete
actions in the project tables.

Change-Id: I976e4e6ed8e9c1430f82ac362c080853744b5d07
Closes-Bug: #1733207

commit_message:
freezer-client: proper use of cacert option

The OPENSTACK_SSL_CACERT dashboard option was incorrectly
passed as 'cert' instead of 'cacert' when initializing the
freezer-client session.

Change-Id: I1f0b9fe27046caa87398800d91a944bb1d72a1e3
Closes-Bug: #1744992
(cherry picked from commit 1843be52c1c72f9b53a6689b35663e5addfabc2b)

subject: Avoids unnecessary lock logging every loop
messages: [{'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2018-01-25 08:44:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2018-01-25 08:49:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2018-01-25 08:50:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2018-01-25 10:40:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2018-01-25 11:29:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-25 08:44:30.000000000', 'message': 'Avoids unnecessary lock logging every loop

_notify_plugin_on_port_updates is called every loop (default - every
2 seconds), and since it has a lock, every lock aquire / release gets
logged if the debug mode is set to True. This can generate a lot of
useless logs, which will make debugging more difficult.

Change-Id: I29045da42ba03209241cc36e3cf0052ed690afc8
Closes-Bug: #1744751
'}]
commit_message:
Avoids unnecessary lock logging every loop

_notify_plugin_on_port_updates is called every loop (default - every
2 seconds), and since it has a lock, every lock aquire / release gets
logged if the debug mode is set to True. This can generate a lot of
useless logs, which will make debugging more difficult.

Change-Id: I29045da42ba03209241cc36e3cf0052ed690afc8
Closes-Bug: #1744751

commit_message:
Remove use of unsupported TEMPEST_SERVICES variable

TEMPEST_SERVICES global variable is not supported
by devstack since long back.
- I380dd20e5ed716a0bdf92aa02c3730359b8136e4
- I9c24705e494689f09a885eb0a640efd50db33fcf

Service availability of tempest known services will be
set by devstack with local check.
- I02be777bf93143d946ccbb8e9eff637bfd1928d4

Related-Bug: #1743688

commit_message:
Append conditionally docker.yaml or docker-ha.yaml.

The way the conditions were handled caused
to have both environment files docker.yaml
and docker-ha.yaml when deployment_with_ha
variable was True.

Change-Id: I33da87f329647ad465e4b8757ce3c98189374441

commit_message:
Add exception handler for container_show

In current version, if a host is force-down, showing any container
in that host will return 500. We should catch exception for
container show. After that, the request will fail with 4xx error.

Change-Id: I8229ae960e2a252ab4496b4717c613c45be15b2c
Closes-Bug: #1735327

[{'created': '2018-01-24 08:29:04.000000000', 'message': 'Move NullHandler to logging module

django.utils.log.NullHandler has been removed in django 1.9.

Switching to use NullHandler from logging module is needed to
upgrade django.

Change-Id: Ie4b97a715bedf967e28fbac5a6640a8252115f5e
'}]
commit_message:
Move NullHandler to logging module

django.utils.log.NullHandler has been removed in django 1.9.

Switching to use NullHandler from logging module is needed to
upgrade django.

Change-Id: Ie4b97a715bedf967e28fbac5a6640a8252115f5e

commit_message:
Remove redirection from trunk details

The redirection is unnecessary for trunk details, as routed-details-view
handles the error case when deleting trunk from details view.

Partially-Implements: blueprint neutron-trunk-ui
Change-Id: I7e0fcccc951064992df9caaecdd45fe2d51d8752

failing in Mistral and blocking patches.

There are cases where more than one network has the same name (e.g.

commit_message:
Fix network find operation

There are cases where more than one network has the same name (e.g.
OpenStack CI gate). We have to fix the network driver so that finding
network by name works.

Change-Id: Ib5a0c947dd716b53e49eced8dbb5ebe9cc8d0000

corresponding container object. If the container_id is None,

'}, {'created': '2018-01-23 02:09:01.000000000', 'message': 'Handle the corner case that container_id is None

commit_message:
Handle the corner case that container_id is None

In periodic task, we use container_id as the key to map the
corresponding container object. If the container_id is None,
it should not be used as a key. Otherwise, the mapping
might not be correct which causes mysterious issues.

Change-Id: I67dc93323f73a38f9d2ebf1a83cad6b6fb3f9b32

commit_message:
Remove redundant exception

Remove UnsupportedResourceType exception defined in
networking_odl/journal/journal.py and use exception defined in
neworking_odl/common/exceptions.py.

Change-Id: Icaaae5f62f58be9f57ab71f1d4b9f946f0840867
Partial-Bug: #1713697

Maybe I'm missing something, but in this review:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/515062/

I can see a tripleo job in the zuul check section, but I didn't notice it here."}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2017-12-12 15:55:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Brian,

I just spent some time with the infra team asking whether I have to migrate also the tripleo job. The answer is no. However, it currently gets executed in the check queue for some of our patches. I am pinging EmilienM to see how to handle this'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2017-12-12 15:55:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2017-12-12 16:12:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Some jobs are now incorrectly voting, like fullstack and dvr-ha. Please sync voting status between old and new flavors.'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2017-12-12 18:27:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2017-12-12 18:29:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2017-12-21 18:15:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

There seems to be no patch that removes the duplicate jobs from the gate. Since we are moving into Christmas time with reduced resources, it may be wise to block the patch to keep the gate as stable as possible for the time of holidays. I block the patch for now, and we can get back to it in January.'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2017-12-29 18:25:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Pushed https://review.openstack.org/#/c/530500/ to preclude the execution of the legacy jobs for master branch that are being moved in this patch. As soon as this patch merges, I will cherry pick it for stable Pike and Ocata and will ready patches to remove the legacy jobs definitions from openstack-infra/project-config and openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-12-29 18:41:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Call your jobs "neutron-X", so use "neutron-" as prefix not anywhere in the name. That makes it clear where they belong.'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2017-12-30 23:28:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2017-12-30 23:28:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2017-12-31 00:04:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2017-12-31 06:43:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-01-02 07:59:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2018-01-03 02:14:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2018-01-03 19:22:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2018-01-25 11:05:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

This patch relocates a number of shared jobs into the neutron repository, so it should not have happened. Grenade and grenade multinode are part of the integrated gate and must be hosted in a qa/infra repo.'}]

Moving legacy check and gate jobs

After the migration to Zuul V3, this patchset relocates all the legacy
check and gate jobs

commit_message:
Enable UWSGI support in monasca-log-api

Community has set a community wide goal
in Pike cycle: "Control Plane API endpoints deployment via WSGI" [1].
monasca-log-api is already capable of being deployed under mod-wsgi but
not under uwsgi. This commits enables that feature. Until Queens release
API will hence support:

* gunicorn
* mod_wsgi (remove in Queens)
* uwsgi (preffered)

Refs:
[1]:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/pike/deploy-api-in-wsgi.html

Story: 2001464
Task: 6180

Change-Id: Ie4a94c9c2e166915c3f4a1783dc3527f4eb62f29

external_ids.

"ovn_l3_gateway_router_hosts", which takes list of chassis
hostnames. If provided, these hosts are consdiered as candidates
to schdule gateway router. Otherwise, chassis which has
ovn-bridge-mappings are considered as candidates.

Change-Id: I4ea66c8b173bcd1885446390ae409c37d46f8275

commit_message:
schedule gateway on hosts from config file

Right now, ovn schedules gateway router ports on a subset
of chassis which has ovn-bridge-mappings configured in
external_ids.

This change is introducing a new config option i.e
"ovn_l3_gateway_router_hosts", which takes list of chassis
hostnames. If provided, these hosts are consdiered as candidates
to schdule gateway router. Otherwise, chassis which has
ovn-bridge-mappings are considered as candidates.

Closes-bug: #1743745
Change-Id: I4ea66c8b173bcd1885446390ae409c37d46f8275

commit_message:
Replace curly quotes with straight quotes

Curly quotes usually input from Chinese input method.
When read from english context, it makes some confusion.

Change-Id: I653631f5eb0d2024d7457d576d7dfd9b38543d20

commit_message:
Bugfix - the "unsupported datasource" warning always appeared

The "unsupported datasource" warning was written to the log without
checking the event_type, so it appeared for every raised/cleared alarm

Change-Id: I5cf20afd4abba0b61278827415430cfd44892bad

commit_message:
API: Node Traits API

Adds basic CRUD on traits, including set and delete of individual
traits.

Bumps the API microversion to 1.37.

NOTE: This patch does not implement the advanced filtering outlined in
the OpenStack API working group's tags guidelines[1]. That will be
implemented in a separate microversion as a follow up patch.

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-wg/guidelines/tags.html

Change-Id: I313fa01fbf20bf0ff19f102ea63b02e72ac2b856
Partial-Bug: #1722194
Co-Authored-By: Mark Goddard <mark@stackhpc.com>

commit_message:
Remove use of unsupported TEMPEST_SERVICES variable

TEMPEST_SERVICES global variable is not supported
by devstack since long back.
- I380dd20e5ed716a0bdf92aa02c3730359b8136e4
- I9c24705e494689f09a885eb0a640efd50db33fcf

Service availability of tempest known services will be
set by devstack with local check.
- I02be777bf93143d946ccbb8e9eff637bfd1928d4

This commit removes the unused TEMPEST_SERVICES setting
Related-Bug: #1743688

Change-Id: I50bd32fc2103af0170ee8d350f31cf589d85422f

WIP: multipart doesn't work yet other tests run successfully in my local

But we need object-server.conf setting.
WIP because I'm still looking at why multipart uploads failed.

Add node traits to API reference

The node traits API was added in API microversion 1.37.

Change-Id: I8c48f2e7662ae9641ec823dc3802d5979a7ea03e
Partial-Bug: #1722194

'}, {'created': '2017-09-04 12:49:42.000000000', 'message': "Only copy nfs_shares to cinder-volume groups

The 'skip' directive is being used in correctly in this task.

'skip' should be true if we don't care if any of the files are found. In
this case we do care, but only if nfs is enabled and we're on a
cinder-volume node. So when is a better way of doing this.

Change-Id: I673950cb6cead9b18ee67a0971ed305ef5e3af2d
Closes-Bug: #1713010
"}, {'created': '2017-10-03 13:25:03.000000000', 'message': 'Only copy nfs_shares to cinder-volume groups

commit_message:
Only copy nfs_shares to cinder-volume groups

Co-Authored-by: Mick Thompson <michael.a.thompson@oracle.com>
Change-Id: I673950cb6cead9b18ee67a0971ed305ef5e3af2d
Closes-Bug: #1713010

commit_message:
Disable jinja2 trim_blocks feature

otherwise, if the jinja2 blocks at the end of the line, it will remove
the last newline character and join two lines into one.

Change-Id: Ie710342fb034e477ff854eba3915dd845bddd257

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-24 11:51:32.000000000', 'message': 'ARA: Prepare the ARA plugin for all the tests

Right now, ARA is being setup when we are running functional tests.
However, we could use it for other type of tests such as the upgrade
ones. As such, we can setup ARA by default as part of the environment
preparation steps.

Change-Id: I49052809c4970592c40a394a31a4d8eca12116e5
'}]
commit_message:
ARA: Prepare the ARA plugin for all the tests

Right now, ARA is being setup when we are running functional tests.
However, we could use it for other type of tests such as the upgrade
ones. As such, we can setup ARA by default as part of the environment
preparation steps.

Change-Id: I49052809c4970592c40a394a31a4d8eca12116e5

commit_message:
freezer-client: proper use of cacert option

The OPENSTACK_SSL_CACERT dashboard option was incorrectly
passed as 'cert' instead of 'cacert' when initializing the
freezer-client session.

Change-Id: I1f0b9fe27046caa87398800d91a944bb1d72a1e3
Closes-Bug: #1744992

Honestly, this is much simpler than I thought it might be. I hadn't thought about that locking on the node_id, its good to have that and its a big gain over the object interface.

... only thing, I wonder if we have the object interface wrong here, maybe not I think, but I found it odd it wasn't a 1:1 mapping."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-01-22 14:19:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> Honestly, this is much simpler than I thought it might be. I hadn't
 > thought about that locking on the node_id, its good to have that
 > and its a big gain over the object interface.
 > 
 > ... only thing, I wonder if we have the object interface wrong
 > here, maybe not I think, but I found it odd it wasn't a 1:1
 > mapping.

I think it's the difference between the API, which sees traits as things that can be added to and removed from nodes, and the ironic object layer which treats traits as objects in their own right which can be created an destroyed. The DB layer is probably back on the attribute list side, as traits don't have an ID. We also don't pass the RPC objects across the RPC boundary. Perhaps they would have been simpler as a list of strings on the Node?"}, {'account_id': 10343, 'date': '2018-01-22 16:32:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Honestly, the fact that we have a separate object to represent Nodes in the api layer is pretty silly - I've sworn for years that I'm going to rewrite it one day to just use the ironic.objects stuff at the API level. Soon............"}, {'account_id': 10343, 'date': '2018-01-22 16:34:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

LGTM, thanks Mark :D'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-01-22 19:09:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7: Patch Set 6 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2018-01-22 20:06:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
Add RPC API and conductor manager for traits

Adds two new methods to the conductor RPC API, add_node_traits and
remove_node_traits, and provides implementations for them in the
conductor manager. add_node_traits can be used to add one or more traits
to a node, or to replace all the traits for a node.  remove_node_traits
can be used to remove one or more traits from a node, or to remove all
traits from a node.

The conductor RPC API version is bumped to 1.44.

Change-Id: I0181df6a41e603874677246066d84bf4ac4f433c
Partial-Bug: #1722194

commit_message:
Include building python-tempestconf from source in Tempest

* python-tempestconf is an automatic Tempest config generator.
  Currently it is used in RefStack and Tripleo projects and
  installed directly RDO shipped tempest RPM package. It would
  be good to include in Tempest container so that it can be while
  using tempest container image from source.

* http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/python-tempestconf

Change-Id: I47e812427343b16662378381e96ab354904256c5

commit_message:
Reinitialize the virtualenv

In the previous patch removing the virtualenv-tools, we've updated
paths to the proper binaries, but we don't reset the virtualenv
like what we used to do.

Hi, Pierre, as this patch changed how the 'validate_instance_nics' behaves, all related unittests should also be updated. Luckily there're not many.

'validate_instance_nics' only use in cluster creation, so currently all supported cluster backend (casssandra, galera, mongodb, redis, vertica) should be affected. You can find all failed unittest in Zuul check job logs(e.g. openstack-tox-py27, http://logs.openstack.org/22/535322/4/check/openstack-tox-py27/f3b0bb9/job-output.json.gz, searching for the line like "Failed 8 tests - output below:", you'll get the list of all failed tests).

The failed test must be all related to this change, you have to update these tests too(the fix may not be complicate, also like what you have done to trove/tests/unittests/cluster/test_models.py:TestModels.test_validate_instance_nics).'}, {'account_id': 18665, 'date': '2018-01-24 18:00:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 18665, 'date': '2018-01-24 18:02:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2018-01-24 18:04:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 16006, 'date': '2018-01-24 18:08:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

subject: SUSE: Switch to upstream MariaDB repository
messages: [{'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-01-24 15:22:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-01-24 17:05:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-01-25 09:27:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-24 15:22:58.000000000', 'message': 'SUSE: Switch to upstream MariaDB repository

The OBS development repository was proven to be quite fragile since
the mariadb packages were moving far to quickly. Whilst this has helped
to catch bugs when OpenStack services were used against newer MariaDB
versions, it also created a very unstable infrastructure for openSUSE
deployments. As such, we have now switched to using the upstream SLE
packages as provided by MariaDB upstream so all distributions are
aligned to how they deploy the Galera clusters. This further allow us
to report upstream bugs which fix problems across all distributions.

Galera server Role fix: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/536955/
Change-Id: Ib270b0fe23de76620491247efc3352fbc6c1e9b5
'}]
commit_message:
SUSE: Switch to upstream MariaDB repository

The OBS development repository was proven to be quite fragile since
the mariadb packages were moving far to quickly. Whilst this has helped
to catch bugs when OpenStack services were used against newer MariaDB
versions, it also created a very unstable infrastructure for openSUSE
deployments. As such, we have now switched to using the upstream SLE
packages as provided by MariaDB upstream so all distributions are
aligned to how they deploy the Galera clusters. This further allow us
to report upstream bugs which fix problems across all distributions.

Galera server Role fix: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/536955/
Change-Id: Ib270b0fe23de76620491247efc3352fbc6c1e9b5

I'm sorry, that's my fault. The right-click options and dependencies on the entity types will be added soon after the functions are clearly organized. Thank you. :)"}, {'account_id': 26171, 'date': '2018-01-09 08:53:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> I would add that this is a vitrage-dashboard spec vitrage backend
 > and client will not be changed
 > 
 > vitrage ui will use the various clients (e.g mistral) to perform
 > the actions

Hello Eyal.

Thank you for your comment

The proposal is a frontend. It is also a vitrage-dashboard spec.

In addition, there are no changes to the vitrage server (backend) and client in the proposal.

Could you explain a little more about the last sentence?

Thanks :)'}, {'account_id': 26171, 'date': '2018-01-09 08:59:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> Cool!

Hello Idan.

Thanks :)'}, {'account_id': 19134, 'date': '2018-01-09 08:59:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Just want to emphasise that this change is a frontend change only
vitrage also has a backend and a client library(python-vitrageclient)

in order to implement executing various action you will need the client libraries to execute them

e.g to run mistral flows you will need to use the python-mistralclient to execute them 

vitrage backend will not be involved in sending these actions
(e.g you don't need to create a new api in vitrage to execute the mistral flow)

hope it helps"}, {'account_id': 26171, 'date': '2018-01-09 09:13:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Just want to emphasise that this change is a frontend change only
 > vitrage also has a backend and a client library(python-vitrageclient)
 > 
 > in order to implement executing various action you will need the
 > client libraries to execute them
 > 
 > e.g to run mistral flows you will need to use the python-mistralclient
 > to execute them
 > 
 > vitrage backend will not be involved in sending these actions
 > (e.g you don't need to create a new api in vitrage to execute the
 > mistral flow)
 > 
 > hope it helps

I understand. Thank you. It is true that in the initial proposal it was different from what you were saying (create a new api in vitrage), but it is going to be done as you say.
Regardless of the Vitrage backend, the frontend will have a simple flow of triggering an API request directly to an external project.

Thanks:)"}, {'account_id': 26171, 'date': '2018-01-15 08:35:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 26171, 'date': '2018-01-15 08:40:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2018-01-15 11:54:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 26171, 'date': '2018-01-16 01:28:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> (1 comment)

Thank you very much

In my opinion, I understand the meaning of 'Configurable'.

If what I understand is correct, I think there is a dependency not only on the entity type but also on the user's open stack construction environment. Is that right?

As you say, it seems that users will need to write the settings required to run the service for the right mouse action in the settings file.

* The basis of the service list will be the settings file.

Also, after reading the settings file, the Vitrage Dashboard will display the list of right mouse actions as an empty list or None if no services are configured (the right mouse action does not disappear, but the list is an empty list or None )

Are you thinking about this?

In addition, it is a method of configuring the service depending on whether the project (Rally, Mistral) is installed or not.

1. Execute Workflow and Performance Test can not be used through the service list if Rally and Mistral endpoints are not created in the settings file.

2. Create True / False in Execute Workflow and Performance Test in setting file. If it is True, use Vitrge-Dashboard to determine whether to install Rally and Mistral through Openstack client (use openstack endpoint list or Openstack service list etc. )and configure the service list.

3. In the process of configuring the service list without setting up Execute Workflow and Performance Test service in setting file, it is to determine whether Mistral or Rally is installed through Openstack client and to automatically include it in the list. However, the user can decide whether to use the service through setting file.

Do you think the way you think is included above?
I think 3 of the methods listed above would be most convenient for the user.

what do you think?"}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2018-01-16 13:34:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Hi Minwook,
 

> If what I understand is correct, I think there is a dependency not
 > only on the entity type but also on the user's open stack
 > construction environment. Is that right?
 
Yes, that's what I meant


 > Also, after reading the settings file, the Vitrage Dashboard will
 > display the list of right mouse actions as an empty list or None if
 > no services are configured (the right mouse action does not
 > disappear, but the list is an empty list or None )


Ok


 > In addition, it is a method of configuring the service depending on
 > whether the project (Rally, Mistral) is installed or not.


If the user knows that he has Mistral/Rally/etc. installed, and he would like to use it as an option in the right-click menu, he should configure it in the settings file. I think it should be similar to the way we set the list of datasources to be used in vitrage.conf (see 'types').

 
 > 1. Execute Workflow and Performance Test can not be used through
 > the service list if Rally and Mistral endpoints are not created in
 > the settings file.


Right


 > 2. Create True / False in Execute Workflow and Performance Test in
 > setting file. If it is True, use Vitrge-Dashboard to determine
 > whether to install Rally and Mistral through Openstack client (use
 > openstack endpoint list or Openstack service list etc. )and
 > configure the service list.


The vitrage-dashboard does not install anything. If Mistral/Rally is not installed, the actions will not be executed. If the user wants these actions, the user should install the needed projects and update the settings."}, {'account_id': 26171, 'date': '2018-01-16 15:40:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

 > is not installed, the actions will not be executed. If the user
 > wants these actions, the user should install the needed projects
 > and update the settings.

Yes, that's right. The vitrage-dashboard does not install anything. All installation and configuration for the project is done by the user.

My guess at number 2 is that the user will choose whether to use it (assuming it is installed)
If it is True then Vitrage-Dashboard will check if it is installed through Openstack client.

Anyway, I will update the contents of the settings file by referring to the above 1 (Endpoint etc.) and the existing datasource file.

Thank you."}, {'account_id': 26171, 'date': '2018-01-22 11:04:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 26171, 'date': '2018-01-22 11:15:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 26171, 'date': '2018-01-22 11:16:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 19159, 'date': '2018-01-23 10:49:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Add action list panel for entity click action

The Vitrage Dashboard now offers several panels for Entity clicks.
Expand the functionality of these Entity Graphs to add the action
list panel as a click action on Entity. Therefore, the user can check
the available action list based on the setting file configured by the user.
In the list of actions, the user can request an external project for
the Entity, and also enter specific parameter values.

Change-Id: I96f3efd569394de6b94bfebe63803d11d76ab953
Implements: blueprint add-action-list-panel

commit_message:
Rebuild for sync charm-helpers

Drop Zesty support (EOL).

Change-Id: I0664f0f6929341eadd7753fa0b05c9c6d9b7c362
(cherry picked from commit cade57d1ebf5a9c3627a1bce0c3b9567a646a6d6)

Looks good, except the project_id/tenant_id thing: could you confirm whether or not it was needed for this change or are you removing it in a following PS ?'}, {'account_id': 55, 'date': '2018-01-17 10:22:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> Looks good, except the project_id/tenant_id thing: could you
 > confirm whether or not it was needed for this change or are you
 > removing it in a following PS ?

Yes, it's needed. In fact when I wrote that patch I realized we have an issue that duplicate the project output when you show a resource as an admin:

openstack bgpvpn show 0ba4f8cc-a9b1-4c21-9bb9-fc825f387220
+----------------------+--------------------------------------+
| Field                | Value                                |
+----------------------+--------------------------------------+
| Associated Networks  |                                      |
| Associated Routers   |                                      |
| Export Targets       |                                      |
| ID                   | 0ba4f8cc-a9b1-4c21-9bb9-fc825f387220 |
| Import Targets       |                                      |
| Name                 | bgpvpn2                              |
| Project              | 28a6c9d3735e4b5eaf14aa90e3f5479b     |
| Route Distinguishers |                                      |
| Route Targets        |                                      |
| Type                 | l3                                   |
| ports                | []                                   |
| project_id           | 28a6c9d3735e4b5eaf14aa90e3f5479b     |
+----------------------+--------------------------------------+

In the last patch set I continue to send the tenant_id property to the API but replace it by project_id a soon as possible and use project_id property in the OSC code."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-01-17 12:48:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

This patch mixes a new feature of port association and several bug fixes (which are found during the development of the port association). Even though they are found during the development, they should be fixed separately from the maintenance perspective? Could you post separate patches?'}, {'account_id': 55, 'date': '2018-01-17 16:27:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

(6 comments)

> (5 comments)
 > 
 > This patch mixes a new feature of port association and several bug
 > fixes (which are found during the development of the port
 > association). Even though they are found during the development,
 > they should be fixed separately from the maintenance perspective?
 > Could you post separate patches?

I revert fixes not related to the port association patch. I'll try later to propose reviews.

@tmorin: I also revert the position argument order, I forget in my last patch set."}, {'account_id': 55, 'date': '2018-01-17 16:30:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 12021, 'date': '2018-01-18 07:33:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Add commands to support BGP VPN route control new API extension

Networking-bgpvpn API extension [0] brings new API calls. That patch
adds command to OSC CLI to support them. It does not implement all the
API extension, still missing new router attribute 'advertise_extra_routes' and
the BGP VPN 'local_pref' attribute.

[0] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/network/v2/index.html#port-associations

Change-Id: I45a160b0caec534d517b103db91dc738c006978b
Partially-Implements: blueprint routes-control
Depends-On: I263e1ee6cf4e1a91be91a4a78f4a160f64d33cc6

commit_message:
Sync charm-helpers

Notable issues resolved:

openstack_upgrade_available() broken for swift
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-swift-proxy/+bug/1743847

haproxy context doesn't consider bindings
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-helpers/+bug/1735421

regression in haproxy check
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-helpers/+bug/1743287

* Zesty is EOL

Change-Id: Ic9aba38e7a0aa21765c26cdde548c0758c36f31b

commit_message:
WIP/DNM: Initial skeleton support for mypy static type checking

Add some initial framework support for doing static type checking using
the mypy program from the 'mypy' package.

Added to the tox 'pep8' section:
  * Using the python3 interpreter as mypy requires Python 3.
  * Calling the mypy program

Added a few static type information lines to the code.

Added 'typing' as a requirement to requirements.txt

Closes-Bug: #1633756
Depends-On: I29bed962a97c8b28b3feb266d76243da4b4cab7a
Change-Id: I9b875fd5a41bc90f058bef055180a61bd235aab3

[{'created': '2018-01-24 00:27:33.000000000', 'message': 'Guarantee timing of installation and render

Previous attempts to solve Bug #1738896 missed the root cause. The
root cause problem is when the configuration file is rendered before
percona is installed. The rendering includes clustering configuration
which causes percona-cluster to automatically do a single bootstrap
when percona-cluster packages are installed leading to the UUID
mismatch.

The timing and ordering of installation, rendering of the
configuration and restart of mysql is critical across all hook
executions.

This change is a partial reversion of Change ID
I95e56bd28152c934f413025a22dd6821b2ad8e94. The change primarily
guarantees percona-cluster is not installed on non-leader nodes
before the leader is bootstrapped and makes sure the configuration
does not get rendered prior to installation.

is_leader_bootstrapped is introduced and guarantees all data expected
from the leader is available to guard on various tasks.

Closes-Bug: #1744961
Closes-Bug: #1738896
Change-Id: Ifeb1520dba3b14fc1b51a586141905a385f2b2c1

commit_message:
Guarantee timing of installation and render

Previous attempts to solve Bug #1738896 missed the root cause. The
root cause problem is when the configuration file is rendered before
percona is installed. The rendering includes clustering configuration
which causes percona-cluster to automatically do a single bootstrap
when percona-cluster packages are installed leading to the UUID
mismatch.

The timing and ordering of installation, rendering of the
configuration and restart of mysql is critical across all hook
executions.

This change is a partial reversion of Change ID
I95e56bd28152c934f413025a22dd6821b2ad8e94. The change primarily
guarantees percona-cluster is not installed on non-leader nodes
before the leader is bootstrapped and makes sure the configuration
does not get rendered prior to installation.

is_leader_bootstrapped is introduced and guarantees all data expected
from the leader is available to guard on various tasks.

Closes-Bug: #1744961
Closes-Bug: #1738896
Change-Id: Ifeb1520dba3b14fc1b51a586141905a385f2b2c1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-24 20:13:21.000000000', 'message': 'Fix node update with PostgreSQL

In the node traits RPC object change [1], the _do_update_node method in
the sqlalchemy DB API was modified to use a select query joined with the
node_tags and node_traits tables in the node update DB operation. This
was done to ensure that the returned NodeModel had its tags and traits
attributes populated rather than lazy loaded. This was found not to work
on PostgreSQL, which presents the following error message [2]:

Exception during message handling: DBNotSupportedError:
(psycopg2.NotSupportedError) FOR UPDATE cannot be applied to the
nullable side of an outer join

This issue is resolved in this commit by reverting to the original query
without joins for the node update, and performing a joined query after
the update.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/532268/13
[2]
http://logs.openstack.org/69/532269/22/check/ironic-tempest-dsvm-pxe_ipmitool-postgres/562b2ea/logs/screen-ir-cond.txt.gz?level=ERROR#_Jan_23_23_59_05_062967

Change-Id: Ib0d49f7e781f1aa0c4496957b00f6c8e3da0ecc0
Related-Bug: #1722194
'}]
commit_message:
Fix node update with PostgreSQL

In the node traits RPC object change [1], the _do_update_node method in
the sqlalchemy DB API was modified to use a select query joined with the
node_tags and node_traits tables in the node update DB operation. This
was done to ensure that the returned NodeModel had its tags and traits
attributes populated rather than lazy loaded. This was found not to work
on PostgreSQL, which presents the following error message [2]:

Exception during message handling: DBNotSupportedError:
(psycopg2.NotSupportedError) FOR UPDATE cannot be applied to the
nullable side of an outer join

This issue is resolved in this commit by reverting to the original query
without joins for the node update, and performing a joined query after
the update.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/532268/13
[2]
http://logs.openstack.org/69/532269/22/check/ironic-tempest-dsvm-pxe_ipmitool-postgres/562b2ea/logs/screen-ir-cond.txt.gz?level=ERROR#_Jan_23_23_59_05_062967

Change-Id: Ib0d49f7e781f1aa0c4496957b00f6c8e3da0ecc0
Related-Bug: #1722194

commit_message:
Sets MAC spoof if neutron port security groups enabled / disabled

MAC spoofing protection is enabled and set by default for all Hyper-V ports.

Other neutron L2 agents are enabling / disabling ARP spoofing protection
for neutron ports if neutron port's security groups are enable or disabled;
behaviour which is not followed by the Neutron Hyper-V Agent.

This patch ensures the same behaviour in this regard.

Closes-Bug: #1744937

Change-Id: I069716fe9a0f4f2d64d43c3c2c565ee7540444a8

commit_message:
Update signal default value

The signal is a string and default value is "None" in request parameters.
If set signal to None as default is unnecessary.

Change-Id: I05050584fdd4134bdd35c761fbb2f835cb9b0f10

commit_message:
Fix the s3tokens endpoint

This was broken when issue_v2_token was removed, and no one noticed
because there are no tests.

The good news is, Swift3 is content to move toward supporting the
v3 format, so just start inheriting from the v3 controller.

Change-Id: I5d0c18121ba4bf8e33209daa48b9d87864951362
Related-Change: I7d3b583cbec9a095ab8cc20c5d6c0a6127e37068
Related-Change: I747de516ab69a47622eecbf8ab3faa34444b3ad5
(cherry picked from commit 3ec1aa4c19c2256cc2db70dbbf9aed717e3d37e9)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-24 16:01:30.000000000', 'message': 'Fix retry mechanism

If the wrong status code is returned, ansible sets failed: true.
This means that a retry is never attempted.

Use .get('status') to work around the possibility that a status
may not be returned in some corner cases. For example:

TASK [grafana : Wait for grafana application ready]
***************** fatal: [some_remote_node]: FAILED! =>
{"failed": true, "msg": "The conditional check 'result.status
== 200' failed. The error was: error while evaluating
conditional (result.status == 200): 'dict object' has no
attribute 'status'"}

Change-Id: I14207d1a9e994fa25c1c061025fff5b64a71d690
Closes-Bug: #1742501
'}]
commit_message:
Fix retry mechanism

If the wrong status code is returned, ansible sets failed: true.
This means that a retry is never attempted.

Use .get('status') to work around the possibility that a status
may not be returned in some corner cases. For example:

TASK [grafana : Wait for grafana application ready]
***************** fatal: [some_remote_node]: FAILED! =>
{"failed": true, "msg": "The conditional check 'result.status
== 200' failed. The error was: error while evaluating
conditional (result.status == 200): 'dict object' has no
attribute 'status'"}

Change-Id: I14207d1a9e994fa25c1c061025fff5b64a71d690
Closes-Bug: #1742501

commit_message:
Merged monasca log api tempest plugin into monasca tempest plugin

* monasca_log_api_tempest.tests -> monasca_tempest_tests.tests.log_api
* monasca_log_api_tempest.clients -> monasca_tempest_tests.clients.log_api
* monasca_log_api_tempest.services -> monasca_tempest_tests.services
* Anything starting with log_api contains monasca_log_api_tempest
  tempest plugin pieces.
* plugin.py and config.py is unified
* We can run monasca_log_api_tempest tests by pass following regex:
  monasca_tempest_tests.tests.log_api
* moved monasca_log_api/tests/base.UNICODE_MESSAGES to
  monasca_tempest_tests.tests.log_api.base.py
* Added devstack plugin to run tempest locally

Story: 2001400
Task: 6082

Change-Id: I44922da236967b5df798f36675828ce78b2e41d8

most of the changes here came directly from the script (below)

#!/bin/bash

sed -i 's/LOG.error(_("/LOG.error(("/' $(grep -l --include='*.py' -r 'LOG.error(_("')

sed -i 's/LOG.warning(_("/LOG.warning(("/' $(grep -l --include='*.py' -r 'LOG.warning(_("')

sed -i 's/LOG.info(_("/LOG.info(("/' $(grep -l --include='*.py' -r 'LOG.info(_("')

sed -i 's/_LI("/("/' $(grep -l --include='*.py' -r '_LI("')

sed -i 's/_LE("/("/' $(grep -l --include='*.py' -r '_LE("')

sed -i 's/_LW("/("/' $(grep -l --include='*.py' -r '_LW("')'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-03-22 15:22:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-03-22 13:18:53.000000000', 'message': 'remove unwanted log translations

recent discussions on the ML have led to the decision to eliminate all
translations for messages that are destined for log files but retain
them for messages that are going to be returned as exceptions and
potentially shown to end users via an API. see [1], [2].

This change does that as follows.

1. If a string is being used to generate an exception, it will still
be translated. Still Trove used both _LE and _ for these translations,
there are some cases where _LE has been simply changed to _, and not
removed.

2. If a string is used for a logging message, remove the use of _,
_LE, _LW, _LI.

Also, I have long felt that we have had a creep of checks in the pep8
tests that apparently make the code easier to read. I strongly believe
that these kinds of "easier to read" things make sense if they are
followed across all projects and not just gratuitously added one
project at a time.

I've taken this opportunity to reduce the merge mess caused by this
change, to sync up our ignore flags with a long list of ignores from
Nova. When they made the change for removing log translation, they
could do it in an automated-way like I have because they didn't have
to deal with under and overindented lines for visual edit (E127). Same
for Cinder.

Changes 448443 [3] and 447839 [4] were inadequate because they only
addressed a little part of the problem, namely removing the use of
_LE, _LI, and _LW, and I think this is a change we don't need to
dribble in a few files at a time. The changes are straightforward and
should be taken in a single lump to make it easy to deal with the
merges coming.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-operators/2017-March/012887.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html
[3] https://review.openstack.org/448443
[4] https://review.openstack.org/447839

Change-Id: I5f86c982469e625997fc8bd15c6fae0fc77a8c64

commit_message:
Remove log translations

According to discussions on the ML, log messages should not be
translated any more. This patch also:
* removes all usage of _LI, _LW, _LE, _LC;
* updates log translation hacking rule.

ML discussions:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2016-November/002574.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html

The original commit messages are kept as following to make a historic
note:

remove unwanted log translations

recent discussions on the ML have led to the decision to eliminate all
translations for messages that are destined for log files but retain
them for messages that are going to be returned as exceptions and
potentially shown to end users via an API. see [1], [2].

This change does that as follows.

1. If a string is being used to generate an exception, it will still
be translated. Still Trove used both _LE and _ for these translations,
there are some cases where _LE has been simply changed to _, and not
removed.

2. If a string is used for a logging message, remove the use of _,
_LE, _LW, _LI.

Also, I have long felt that we have had a creep of checks in the pep8
tests that apparently make the code easier to read. I strongly believe
that these kinds of "easier to read" things make sense if they are
followed across all projects and not just gratuitously added one
project at a time.

I've taken this opportunity to reduce the merge mess caused by this
change, to sync up our ignore flags with a long list of ignores from
Nova. When they made the change for removing log translation, they
could do it in an automated-way like I have because they didn't have
to deal with under and overindented lines for visual edit (E127). Same
for Cinder.

Changes 448443 [3] and 447839 [4] were inadequate because they only
addressed a little part of the problem, namely removing the use of
_LE, _LI, and _LW, and I think this is a change we don't need to
dribble in a few files at a time. The changes are straightforward and
should be taken in a single lump to make it easy to deal with the
merges coming.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-operators/2017-March/012887.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html
[3] https://review.openstack.org/448443
[4] https://review.openstack.org/447839

Co-Authored-By: Amrith Kumar <amrith@amrith.org>
Co-Authored-By: Valencia Serrao <vserrao@us.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I5f86c982469e625997fc8bd15c6fae0fc77a8c64

commit_message:
Use placement-client rather than placement-api

The Placement API runs on the controller, so placement-client should
be used on the compute node.

Change-Id: I872076ad639833c79faf0399f9b6ef533d73e709
Closes-Bug: #1744112

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-24 04:49:22.000000000', 'message': 'Add procname for uwsgi based services

Code in grenade and elsewhere rely on the process/service name
when one runs "ps auxw" and they grep for example "grep -e glance-api"
to check if the service is running. with uwsgi, let us make sure
we use process name prefix so it is easier to spot the services
and be compatible with code elsewhere that relies on this.

Follow patch set I4d1cd223ed9904fcb19b26fc9362b676e0b4f9b3
Change-Id: I78e6f578d26f6ed6f8ec2b336da55316e25e5ad9
'}]
commit_message:
Add procname for uwsgi based services

Code in grenade and elsewhere rely on the process/service name
when one runs "ps auxw" and they grep for example "grep -e glance-api"
to check if the service is running. with uwsgi, let us make sure
we use process name prefix so it is easier to spot the services
and be compatible with code elsewhere that relies on this.

Follow patch set I4d1cd223ed9904fcb19b26fc9362b676e0b4f9b3
Change-Id: I78e6f578d26f6ed6f8ec2b336da55316e25e5ad9

[{'account_id': 25505, 'date': '2018-01-09 14:47:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26222, 'date': '2018-01-11 02:42:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Mardim, I find out that FC_MAP support 'name' parameter when create flow-classifier in https://github.com/openstack/tacker/blob/master/tacker/nfvo/drivers/vim/openstack_driver.py#L72, . IMO, we can add 'name' to MATCH_CRITERIA  and MATCH_DB_KEY_LIST in https://github.com/openstack/tacker/blob/master/tacker/db/nfvo/vnffg_db.py#L42. In this cases, we can keep vnffgd simple as before:

- name: http-flow-classifier
  network_src_port_id: 640dfd77-c92b-45a3-b8fc-22712de480e1
  destination_port_range: 80-1024
  ip_proto: 6
  ip_dst_prefix: 192.168.1.2/24
What you add name to database looks good to me. You can check https://github.com/openstack/tacker/blob/master/tacker/db/migration/README to migrate to newest database."}, {'account_id': 25505, 'date': '2018-01-11 07:13:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Hi Mardim, I find out that FC_MAP support 'name' parameter when
 > create flow-classifier in https://github.com/openstack/tacker/blob/master/tacker/nfvo/drivers/vim/openstack_driver.py#L72,
 > . IMO, we can add 'name' to MATCH_CRITERIA  and MATCH_DB_KEY_LIST
 > in https://github.com/openstack/tacker/blob/master/tacker/db/nfvo/vnffg_db.py#L42.
 > In this cases, we can keep vnffgd simple as before:
 > 
 > - name: http-flow-classifier
 > network_src_port_id: 640dfd77-c92b-45a3-b8fc-22712de480e1
 > destination_port_range: 80-1024
 > ip_proto: 6
 > ip_dst_prefix: 192.168.1.2/24
 > What you add name to database looks good to me. You can check
 > https://github.com/openstack/tacker/blob/master/tacker/db/migration/README
 > to migrate to newest database.

IMHO I think is a bad tactic to add name to match criteria from sfc perspective. Because the user will be confused if he sees the name along with the rest match criteria because the name is not an acl match criterion. I think is better to separate the name from the pure acls criteria. In addition to that is not so big change to the vnffgd file, we just make it a lit bit more modular."}, {'account_id': 25505, 'date': '2018-01-11 13:04:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-01-11 13:22:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

[{'created': '2018-01-09 14:47:07.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Naming classifiers

commit_message:
Add names to classifiers in the vnffgd template

The functinality of naming the classifiers which are
created through a vnffgd template is essential so the user
can identify somehow the classifiers that he created for a chain.

In addition to that the classifiers' names would be an important
tool in subsequent patches where we will use them to update the ACL
of an existing classifier though the vnffgd template. We are going to
use the name to identify which classifier's ACL the user wants to
update.

Change-Id: Ia586061c578a99662d49ad284d1ff313c350e1f3
Signed-off-by: Dimitrios Markou <mardim@intracom-telecom.com>

commit_message:
add whereto for testing redirect rules

Use whereto to test that the redirect rules do what we expect. The
test coverage is a bit minimal for now, but should be useful as an
example of how it can be extended. The test files in the
openstack-manuals repo provide some other examples.

Depends-On: I36003d3525dcc9fef8e5f008ecabb2b2ac78088e
Change-Id: Ia14bfa6c89fd04844842d727d11ff8874ec7fc2a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add param for controlling which nova endpoint is used

This patch adds the 'neutron::notifications::endpoint_type' parameter
to allow controlling which endpoint from the keystone catalog is used
when communicating with nova.

Change-Id: I4d17fb08634c3da3ac59a7c1fe728657e4da2c3f
Partial-Bug: #1745002

I updated the vnffg_usage_guide :)'}, {'account_id': 25505, 'date': '2017-10-30 10:08:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 19:

> Other problem, currently Tacker client doesn't support updating
 > vnffg.
 > When I run command: tacker vnffg-update -h, I see only vnf mapping
 > and symmetrical can be updated.

By updating vnffg we mean that we want to update some specific part of the vnffg such as the vnfs that we use in the chain or the criteria that we use in the classifier.

Currently we do not support the update of the classifier that we use in the vnffg but we support the update of the vnfs that we use in the chain. 

To do so we need to execute: 

'tacker vnffg-update --vnf-mapping VNFD:<id of the VNF> <vnffg-name>'  

And through the aforementioned command we can replace the vnf that we use in the a chain with the VNF that we use in the vnffg-update command. And through this we update the chain and the vnffg in general.

For more information you can read the updated vnffg_usage_guide.rst

I hope I don't miss something here.

What do you think ?"}, {'account_id': 26222, 'date': '2017-10-30 11:43:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

(3 comments)

commit_message:
Implement the vnf-mapping update functionality

Although tacker client side supports the update of the VNFs which
are currently used in an existing VNFFG this functionality is not
implemented at the Tacker server side.

Through this patch we are trying to address exactly that problem.
Also this patch is the first step for the implementation of this:

Implements: blueprint update-vnffg

Change-Id: I147e9f8a52f3e307767cd855492eb9bb5867cf29
Signed-off-by: Dimitrios Markou <mardim@intracom-telecom.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-17 22:09:17.000000000', 'message': "Reset state every iteration to avoid stale reference

If you get a valid but unexpected response status you have to continue
the loop.  If you don't reset resp = None some kinds of exceptions might
get re-raised as with the wrong error.

Change-Id: I5751dfbc176155bea63103a64fd8d4db62323e60
"}]
commit_message:
Reset state every iteration to avoid stale reference

If you get a valid but unexpected response status you have to continue
the loop.  If you don't reset resp = None some kinds of exceptions might
get re-raised as with the wrong error.

Change-Id: I5751dfbc176155bea63103a64fd8d4db62323e60

@Juan Antonio Osorio Robles

I would like to discuss with you some points that need for rolling upgrade:

1. RPC version
- Here is my patch set for it: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/466247/

2. Trigger
- Keystone and Glance are using trigger to avoid downtime when there are some affection to db like add/delete/rename. However there is no change db from newton, moreover, dave said that "there will be not change db in the future" so I am afraid that trigger is redundancy for barbican. 

For Neutron and Nova, there is a rule that:
- allow add column or table to database
- don't allow rename columns or tables
- don't allow rename/delete columns or tables in one cycle, it means we can delete a columns or tables from last two cycle (N-2).

3. OVO
In my understanding, OVO is used when agents want to get information from server via RPC. At this time, OVO on server will depend on the version of object to modify suitable info then return agents. 
- Comparing with the Barbican's architecture, there are no agents do like this. So I am wondering whether it needs OVO or not?

That would be great if I get your option about these.'}, {'account_id': 8623, 'date': '2017-06-06 15:59:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

subject: Prometheus-openstack-exporter: fix python path
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-25 05:20:57.000000000', 'message': "Prometheus-openstack-exporter: fix python path

This PS is to fix python execute file's path from
/usr/local/bin/prometheus_openstack_exporter/exporter.py
to /usr/local/bin/exporter/main.py, as prometheus-
openstack-exporter image has been changed.

Change-Id: Ie179f3263aafbaea6dd409661fbaa9309deb510f
"}]
commit_message:
Prometheus-openstack-exporter: fix python path

This PS is to fix python execute file's path from
/usr/local/bin/prometheus_openstack_exporter/exporter.py
to /usr/local/bin/exporter/main.py, as prometheus-
openstack-exporter image has been changed.

Change-Id: Ie179f3263aafbaea6dd409661fbaa9309deb510f

Add new interface Config variables added to Nexus plugin.
    vnc_pool
    intfcfg_portchannel
    https_verify
    https_local_certificate
Identify variables which are obsolete and those being deprecated.
Change default to switch_heartbeat_time.

Change-Id: I940659bdd448b7bda1c38d9343ec6322390b027a

(cherry picked from commit a273479e1e7b64bcbfb294f8c825d7872e159789)
'}]
commit_message:
Latest Nexus Configuration Variables Updates

Add new interface Config variables added to Nexus plugin.
    vnc_pool
    intfcfg_portchannel
    https_verify
    https_local_certificate
Identify variables which are obsolete and those being deprecated.
Change default to switch_heartbeat_time.

Change-Id: I940659bdd448b7bda1c38d9343ec6322390b027a
Closes-bug:  #1672496
(cherry picked from commit a273479e1e7b64bcbfb294f8c825d7872e159789)

subject: Revert "Ensure only api app initializes secret store"
messages: [{'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-01-24 10:50:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-01-24 10:51:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2018-01-24 15:48:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1\n\nReverting this is not the answer.  Seems like the initialization does not take place only intermittently.  I'm going to write a patch to move this initialization to a run of db-sync.  That way we know it only runs once and its a lot easier to debug."}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-01-25 05:43:08.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-24 10:50:44.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Ensure only api app initializes secret store"

This reverts commit 0539a28ee95479a707b7dc3da635308a682e2ecc.

Even though the commit fixes race conditions, it ends up not
initializing the secret store correctly.

Change-Id: I79de1954e3fae2c32e64acfa2400a8803ab09e08
Related-Bug: #1744151
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Ensure only api app initializes secret store"

This reverts commit 0539a28ee95479a707b7dc3da635308a682e2ecc.

Even though the commit fixes race conditions, it ends up not
initializing the secret store correctly.

Change-Id: I79de1954e3fae2c32e64acfa2400a8803ab09e08
Related-Bug: #1744151

This is done to prevent formatting errors when it's being evaluated
later on.

commit_message:
Allow octavia specific client config options

Allows for using specific endpoint_type for octavia service.
This was missed in d0787393ce1ba073a317c3dccff8251068a707ac

Change-Id: I9efc1ba306d11b40f7ca4d609a9282c64debdca3
Partial-Bug: #1737567

Add details about SRIOV enablement to the networking guide

Neutron and Nova methods are included.

Addressed comments

Change-Id: Ic3d30bc76a298185fe978a470c64e805dd19a162

[{'account_id': 26456, 'date': '2017-07-26 22:12:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2017-07-26 22:12:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-07-26 22:52:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

- gate-kolla-ansible-dsvm-deploy-ceph-oraclelinux-binary-centos-7-2-node-nv http://logs.openstack.org/10/487610/6/check/gate-kolla-ansible-dsvm-deploy-ceph-oraclelinux-binary-centos-7-2-node-nv/cc47314/ : SUCCESS in 44m 48s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2017-09-09 18:38:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

more changes  are needed from https://docs.openstack.org/ocata/networking-guide/config-sriov.html 

for example mechanism driver, which makes me think neutron-server also need sriov config and potentially sriov code installed  (not sure about this last thing)'}, {'account_id': 26553, 'date': '2017-09-10 12:52:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Contructive for there are no other solutions in openstack community  with the SR-IOV field now.
And I also agree with Eduardo Gonzalez's opinion that SR-IOV is more related with COMPUTE GROUP than NEUTRON GROUP.
Still there are lots of other questions about SR-IOV itself such as PHY-NIC type limitation, VF-port mirroring support, etc.

So we also need go ahead to improve these gradually."}, {'account_id': 23046, 'date': '2017-09-11 20:14:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

This implementation was kept to be minimal as there are many possible options for SRIOV that can be configured in ml2_conf. Along with various NIC vendors having multiple configuration options.
Think the ml2_conf configuration can be documented as it is with the other review rather than convoluting ml2_conf.

Believe this can be merged in with minimal impact to the main codebase. With future changes making SR-IOV more dynamic in configuration.'}, {'account_id': 26456, 'date': '2017-09-13 20:53:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 26456, 'date': '2017-09-13 21:03:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

As Charlie said, the idea was to leave the source ml2_conf alone and have users override it in /etc/kolla/config, since there are so many possible configurations for SRIOV.  This way, the source ml2_conf is kept simple.  The new SRIOV section in the networking guide includes instructions on configuring the ml2_conf override.

As for the code change question, there are no other changes required for other containers.  Neutron server already has the SRIOV mechanism driver included.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-09-13 22:34:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

commit_message:
Add support for Neutron SRIOV agent container

Agent is required for Neutron SRIOV post Mitaka
Closes-Bug: #1655921

Addressed comments
Added release notes

Change-Id: Ib8181c4da65fccd0c5f8487217060e5682977665

commit_message:
Remove alarm_rule from aodh tests

threshold_rule is no longer supported and removed from congress code
in I9cbe3f1307b78d0e703069bc6c011b62c0d3c51f . This commit updates the
tempest tests regadring the same.

This commit also disables HA tests until the bug is fixed
https://bugs.launchpad.net/congress/+bug/1745112

Closes-Bug: #1743729
Change-Id: I5c26c8e77f15f9ea0f075dc23e7249bba5a56e8c

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-19 19:14:58.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid duplicated message in Batch/DeleteAction

Previously BatchAction.handle() automatically adds an error message
when handle() method raises an exception. If some custom error message
is shown in handle() method, two error messages will be shown.

This commit allows a special handling for HandledException to
BatchAction.handle(). In individual BatchAction instances,
handle() method can now show a custom error message and raise an
HandledException, and then BatchAction.handle() skips to show an
error message for that. The reason of using HandledException is
because the exception can be raised from exceptions.handle() function
which is commonly used to handle exceptions.

The common pattern in handle() would be:

 try:
    <do something>
 except Exception as e:
    # HandledException which wrapps the original exception will be raised.
    # HandledException will be caught by BatchAction.handle().
    exceptions.handle(request, msg, escalate=True)

To make it easier to use the pattern, a new decorator
horizon.tables.actions.handle_exception_with_detail_message is introduced.

DeleteActiona and BatchAction in the network, subnet and router tables
are improved using the new decorator.

Closes-Bug: #1733207
Change-Id: I4bb0f61c7b63ea6ecd2e30c03eddecee62ff9b13
'}, {'created': '2017-11-19 19:21:03.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid duplicated message in Batch/DeleteAction

horizon.tables.actions.handle_exception_with_detail_message is introduced.

DeleteActiona and BatchAction in the network, subnet and router tables
are improved using the new decorator.

Closes-Bug: #1733207

commit_message:
Avoid duplicated message in Batch/DeleteAction

Previously BatchAction.handle() automatically adds an error message
when handle() method raises an exception. If some custom error message
is shown in handle() method, two error messages will be shown.

This commit allows a special handling for HandledException to
BatchAction.handle(). In individual BatchAction instances,
handle() method can now show a custom error message and raise an
HandledException, and then BatchAction.handle() skips to show an
error message for that. The reason of using HandledException is
because the exception can be raised from exceptions.handle() function
which is commonly used to handle exceptions.

The common pattern in handle() would be:

 try:
    <do something>
 except Exception as e:
    # HandledException which wrapps the original exception will be raised.
    # HandledException will be caught by BatchAction.handle().
    exceptions.handle(request, msg, escalate=True)

To make it easier to use the pattern, a new decorator
horizon.tables.actions.handle_exception_with_detail_message is introduced.

Partial-Bug: #1733207
Change-Id: I4bb0f61c7b63ea6ecd2e30c03eddecee62ff9b13

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-19 19:14:58.000000000', 'message': "Avoid sending error message twice in BatchAction

BatchAction.handle() displays an aggregate error message
if an exception is returned from individual action() method.
If we don't need a detail error message, try/except is unnecessary.

Note that a fix for a case where a detail error message is needed
will be covered in the subsequent patches.

Change-Id: I8037355b12e0756c6add5c5b9ba05a430155dfe5
Partial-Bug: #1733207

commit_message:
Avoid sending error message twice in BatchAction

BatchAction.handle() displays an aggregate error message
if an exception is returned from individual action() method.
If we don't need a detail error message, try/except is unnecessary.

Note that a fix for a case where a detail error message is needed
will be covered in the subsequent patches.

Change-Id: I8037355b12e0756c6add5c5b9ba05a430155dfe5
Partial-Bug: #1733207

I am not familiar with this area, but from my general impression some refactoring is being done at the same time Could you change step by step? Otherwise we cannot be confident that it contains no regression. (at least it is hard for me to review and I would like to let others review this)'}, {'account_id': 15554, 'date': '2018-01-11 13:33:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 15554, 'date': '2018-01-11 13:49:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> [Some suggestions to attract reviewers] It is hard to review. It
 > seem the spinner change and refactoring are mixed. I am not
 > familiar with this area, but from my general impression some
 > refactoring is being done at the same time Could you change step by
 > step? Otherwise we cannot be confident that it contains no
 > regression. (at least it is hard for me to review and I would like
 > to let others review this)

Thanks for the feedback Akihiro. Also sorry for the slow response, I was out of the office for two weeks.

I fully agree that this change is complex and hard to review. Unfortunately I don't see how to make it simpler. What may look like refactoring is not really refactoring.

All the code inside the modal was originally (ie. before this change) written with the assumption that it all runs synchronously. But this change invalidated that assumption and forced me to make changes all around (probably that's what looked like refactoring to you). Since those changes are consequences of turning synchronous code into asynchronous code I don't see how could I move them into separate changes.

Anyway to help the reviewers I managed to find a tiny change I could break out. That I broke out. Plus I uploaded a trick I used to make the async behavior slow so anyone can see it and play with it from the UI."}, {'account_id': 15554, 'date': '2018-01-12 07:53:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

[{'created': '2017-11-30 16:11:07.000000000', 'message': "WIP Trunks panel: eliminate spinner at create/edit

TODO Some test coverage (0.35% branch coverage, sigh), I'm struggling
with covering the hideAllocated() functions of the step controllers.
How do I unit test watchCollection?

Change how the UI reacts to neutron responding to API requests.

Without this change when the user clicks create or edit:
* we display a spinner
* wait for the neutron to respond
* then we open the modal.

With this change:
* we open the modal immediately and
* send the request(s) to neutron asynchronously.
* We display a 'please wait' message in place of the relevant (but not
  all) input forms (or transfer tables) of the workflow steps.
* When neutron responds to each request we replace the 'please wait'
  message with the pre-filled input forms.

The latter is better experience for the user because he or she can
progress with parts of the workflow until the rest is loaded.

Partially-Implements: blueprint neutron-trunk-ui
Change-Id: I9ac8f75a390424ad05cf51fa679ef9803124179c

commit_message:
Trunks panel: eliminate spinner at create/edit

Change how the UI reacts to neutron responding to API requests.

Without this change when the user clicks create or edit:
* we display a spinner
* wait for the neutron to respond
* then we open the modal.

With this change:
* we open the modal immediately and
* send the request(s) to neutron asynchronously.
* We display a 'please wait' message in place of the relevant (but not
  all) input forms (or transfer tables) of the workflow steps.
* When neutron responds to each request we replace the 'please wait'
  message with the pre-filled input forms.

The latter is better experience for the user because he or she can
progress with parts of the workflow until the rest is loaded.

Partially-Implements: blueprint neutron-trunk-ui
Change-Id: I9ac8f75a390424ad05cf51fa679ef9803124179c

commit_message:
Shift javascript publish jobs to post

The publish job is where we upload tarballs to tarballs.o.o. The release
job is where we upload to npm.

Change-Id: Icc6bd876056e355e71ccefa64156b5e3c8d43e8d
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/536945

commit_message:
Check profiler instance before initialize

Add a small check for this to an prevent issue in Nova [1]
that causes some commands not working.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/641262/

Change-Id: I685386695e13bf5034a1008dbdcff4539eb482d2
Closes-Bug: #1743586

commit_message:
Add basic functional tests

This patch add openstack client call, use openstack client
execute profile, policy, cluster, node, receiver, action,
event list operation.

messages:
[{'account_id': 27576, 'date': '2018-01-02 11:52:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-01-02 11:52:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 27576, 'date': '2018-01-25 03:18:41.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

already fix'}]

commit_message:
Add identity API 3.0 Version support in CLIClient

This change adds API 3.0 interface to solve a error that the
server could not comply with the request when I run sahara-tests
project.
Becault identity API version is 3.0 in sahara-tests project, the
2.0 is only available in CLIClient of the tempest.

Change-Id: Ic6753321549f4e6077a13ad2cf4060c78e0b519e
Closes-Bug:#1740853

commit_message:
Don't set use_stderr = False for tests

Since the option is False by default in the oslo.log library, this is
effectively a no-op. Also it may confuse readers that try to understand
how logging is set up for tests.

The patch was ported from a neutron patches [1]

TrivialFix

[1] I091566519912251547c703139b38daea2979a93d

Change-Id: Ic12ed498663743d9b3fcda8a91c8586fa5a609f9

commit_message:
Latest Nexus Configuration Variables Updates

Add new interface Config variables added to Nexus plugin.
    vnc_pool
    intfcfg_portchannel
    https_verify
    https_local_certificate
Identify variables which are obsolete and those being deprecated.
Change default to switch_heartbeat_time.

Change-Id: I940659bdd448b7bda1c38d9343ec6322390b027a
Closes-bug:  #1672496
(cherry picked from commit a273479e1e7b64bcbfb294f8c825d7872e159789)

messages:
[{'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-01-11 04:04:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-01-11 04:05:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-01-12 02:02:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

So interestingly enough... some of these failures appear to be things calling the list method with incorrect query params themselves. Which could be leftovers from some other functionality in Resource1, or something else I may potentially be missing.


openstack.tests.unit.network.v2.test_floating_ip.TestFloatingIP.test_find_available_nada
Appears to call floating_ip.find_available which passing in fields='id' which I don't know what it actually does... it isn't in the query mapping, fields isn't a param on list itself. So it's a param that just looks like it is dropped on the floor.

I'll keep digging through the tests to see what other ones are doing and if we have similar problems elsewhere."}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-01-12 04:21:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-01-12 04:24:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Alright, there we go.

commit_message:
Raise error when supplying invalid query params

Rather than stripping invalid query params and then
continuing the API call, lets actually throw an error
since we explicitly define what valid query params are.

This stops people from accidentally querying for an
incorrect param, getting back a list of 'everything' and
then acting on it assuming it was a valid query.

Adds a util function for getting keys from format strings
as the checking for invalid keys needs to take into account
what key may be required for the base_url.

Change-Id: If30badb4d71e521100a0e8974978eb6d5fa2699f

commit_message:
Fix until_complete parameter in nova crons

The until_complete paramenter needs to be translated
correctly to the CLI option --until-complete instead of
--until_complete.

Change-Id: Ib5b32d02292e7d9b2f6985544e7d9e3f51f979b5
Closes-Bug: 1745120

commit_message:
Add some docs about not using Profile

We list profile and authenticator as deprecated, but with no docs
providing suggestions as to what to do.

Add some docs.

These can be cleaned up a little bit as we continue to reorganize the
new code. For instance, you can actually do all of these just with the
Connection object, but only once we've released. Pointing people at
getting a cloud_config object for now allows writing code that will work
with both old and new interfaces.

Change-Id: I519c672d1a3905ef8695287d73fce0949576505d

commit_message:
Fix outdated links

Due to the migration of the OpenStack document library, some outdated
links were found during use, using https instead of http and pointing
to the right place.

Change-Id: I09ee2477d94c29bfbaf26d01ceef4c2eeb403852

commit_message:
Introduce assertions for system-scoped token testing

This commit consists of some utilities that we can use when testing
system-scoped tokens. A subsequent patch will use them when
implementing the tests.

bp system-scope

Change-Id: If011ff7630cda1f7330a7657dd8e6249f0af5442

commit_message:
Implement system-scope in the token provider API

This change incorporates system-scope changes into the token provider
API. A subsequent patch will wire up the necessary controller bits
that expose the functionality via the API.

bp system-scope

Change-Id: I15ed4b96d3e0d78f85ca61a3d85274c770c4c7cf

commit_message:
Teach TokenFormatter how to handle system scope

This commit adds a new payload type that is meant to allow
system-scoped token. A subsequent patch will actually wire this up
to the token provider API and another patch to expose it via the
authentication API.

bp system-scope

Change-Id: I26357b6d62ce88ad116e0231145b2367dda62fa2

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-23 19:48:08.000000000', 'message': 'Fetch javascript output on publish jobs too

We were only fetching the tarballs on the release jobs, not on the
publish jobs. That makes the publish job not so much of a publish job.

Change-Id: I8e6b12e61bcc42d2896c4fb574aaf6f1718e1bdb
'}]
commit_message:
Fetch javascript output on publish jobs too

We were only fetching the tarballs on the release jobs, not on the
publish jobs. That makes the publish job not so much of a publish job.

Change-Id: I8e6b12e61bcc42d2896c4fb574aaf6f1718e1bdb

check and gate pipelines as a voting job for refstack-client.
