revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-19 19:46:39.000000000', 'message': 'Add IPv6 support to scenario tests

This patch adds IPv6 variation to scenario tests and makes
necessary changes to manila plugin and devstack to run it.

Change-Id: I4ca727f92618998242af18908bbbda6bb5f86303
'}, {'created': '2017-12-20 17:05:51.000000000', 'message': 'Add IPv6 support to scenario tests

This patch adds IPv6 variation to scenario tests and makes
necessary changes to manila plugin and devstack to run it.

Part the changes included the dependency of
neutron-dynamic-routing plugin and the installation
of quagga, so routes in devstack host can be created
automatically for each router and private network
created by tempest during the tests.

Also, added a new config option "override_ip_for_nfs_access"
for manila tempest plugin that overrides the access rules used
for NFS scenario tests. This option can be set by exporting the
environment variable "OVERRIDE_IP_FOR_NFS_ACCESS" with the
intended value before running devstack.

Change-Id: I4ca727f92618998242af18908bbbda6bb5f86303
'}, {'created': '2017-12-20 22:01:28.000000000', 'message': 'Add IPv6 support to scenario tests

'}, {'created': '2018-01-17 18:14:37.000000000', 'message': 'Update manila plugin to support IPv6

This patch makes necessary changes to devstack manila
plugin in order to be able to run IPv6 scenario tests.

Part of the changes included the dependency of
neutron-dynamic-routing plugin and the installation
of quagga, so routes in devstack host can be created
automatically for each router and private network
created by tempest during the tests.

Also, added a new config option "override_ip_for_nfs_access"
for manila tempest plugin that overrides the access rules used
for NFS scenario tests. This option can be set by exporting the
environment variable "OVERRIDE_IP_FOR_NFS_ACCESS" with the
intended value before running devstack.

This change is enabled and tested alongside a change on
manila-tempest-plugin project.

Change-Id: I4ca727f92618998242af18908bbbda6bb5f86303
'}, {'created': '2018-01-17 20:22:27.000000000', 'message': 'Update manila plugin to support IPv6

of quagga, so routes in devstack host can be created
automatically for each router and private network
created by tempest during the tests.

for manila tempest plugin that overrides the access rules used
for NFS scenario tests. This option can be set by exporting the
environment variable "OVERRIDE_IP_FOR_NFS_ACCESS" with the
intended value before running devstack.

This change is enabled by a following change and
tested alongside a change on manila-tempest-plugin
project.

commit_message:
Update manila plugin to support IPv6

This patch makes necessary changes to devstack manila
plugin in order to be able to run IPv6 scenario tests.

Part of the changes included the dependency of
neutron-dynamic-routing plugin and the installation
of quagga, so routes in devstack host can be created
automatically for each router and private network
created by tempest during the tests.

Also, added a new config option "override_ip_for_nfs_access"
for manila tempest plugin that overrides the access rules used
for NFS scenario tests. This option can be set by exporting the
environment variable "OVERRIDE_IP_FOR_NFS_ACCESS" with the
intended value before running devstack.

This change is enabled by a following change and
tested alongside a change on manila-tempest-plugin
project.

Please note that we are temporarily disabling IPv6
functionality in Host-assisted Share Migration, as
the Data Service is not able to handle IPv4 + IPv6
scenarios.

Change-Id: I4ca727f92618998242af18908bbbda6bb5f86303
Needed-By: Id8b005cdd429d53a75624885fe7ca795746c3ede

commit_message:
flake8: enable import rule

I202 the rule to check additional newlines in group of imports
was disabled. It is enabled back by reshuffling and arranging
import order.

Co-Authored-By: Manjeet Singh Bhatia<manjeet.s.bhatia@intel.com>
Change-Id: I5c9b7df9db640cfb837656c254c16f4f31b68e43

[{'created': '2017-10-30 19:53:42.000000000', 'message': 'v2 image update fix

Passing attributes to jsonpatch.make_patch requires that the "new" value
also have the original attributes that are not being modified with the
request.  If only the new attributes are passed in, jsonpatch creates a
bunch of "remove" requests that are rejected by the API.

This patch copies the original attributes into a new dict and
modifies the relevant ones before passing the new dict to jsonpatch

Change-Id: I301e7e736c68a47b6caba8623c434a64cea9fc67

commit_message:
v2 image update fix

Passing attributes to jsonpatch.make_patch requires that the "new" value
also have the original attributes that are not being modified with the
request.  If only the new attributes are passed in, jsonpatch creates a
bunch of "remove" requests that are rejected by the API.

This patch copies the original attributes into a new dict and
modifies the relevant ones before passing the new dict to jsonpatch

Change-Id: I301e7e736c68a47b6caba8623c434a64cea9fc67

commit_message:
Accept port and portgroup as volume connector types

This patch adds 'port' and 'portgroup' as types of volume connectors.
These types can be used to get an IP address for an iSCSI initiator,
which is required for some volume backend, in the case where a port or
a portgroup is used for an iSCSI initiator.

Closes-Bug: #1715529
Change-Id: I43801332057cb3bf614db0d26181df286c78adae

commit_message:
Migrate python-oneviewclient validations to oneview hardware type

As part of the process to stop the use of ``python-oneviewclient``
in favor of ``python-hpOneView`` and ``python-ilorest-library``, the
validations of the ``python-oneviewclient`` have to be migrated to
the ``oneview`` hardware type.

Change-Id: I9031f6e9a59901d3241c6802938252bb63cfe6ca
Partial-Bug: #1693788

[{'created': '2018-01-08 18:35:11.000000000', 'message': 'Checksum-fill proxied metadata replies

Sometimes a proxied metadata reply can be dropped by
the hypervisor because of an invalid checksum.  Always
fill-in the checksum just like we do for DHCP replies.

Change-Id: I46987da3bf05577ff0a51a490f26cf2be3c3c266
Closes-bug: #1722584
(cherry picked from commit ed1c3b021751273e427d47fcf544c56bdabf97bb)
'}]
commit_message:
Checksum-fill proxied metadata replies

Sometimes a proxied metadata reply can be dropped by
the hypervisor because of an invalid checksum.  Always
fill-in the checksum just like we do for DHCP replies.

Change-Id: I46987da3bf05577ff0a51a490f26cf2be3c3c266
Closes-bug: #1722584
(cherry picked from commit ed1c3b021751273e427d47fcf544c56bdabf97bb)

messages:
[{'account_id': 23733, 'date': '2016-10-07 18:45:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-10-07 18:51:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-python-ironicclient-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://docs-draft.openstack.org/66/383866/1/check/gate-python-ironicclient-docs-ubuntu-xenial/39352b5//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 3m 11s

- gate-python-ironicclient-python27-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/66/383866/1/check/gate-python-ironicclient-python27-ubuntu-xenial/fc910c4/ : SUCCESS in 2m 46s

- python-ironicclient-coverage-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/66/383866/1/check/python-ironicclient-coverage-ubuntu-xenial/1cd69cd/ : SUCCESS in 2m 35s'}, {'account_id': 12356, 'date': '2016-10-09 18:48:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14525, 'date': '2016-10-10 09:55:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10342, 'date': '2016-11-30 22:41:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Just an observation: Neither Ironic, nor Nova's doc/source/conf.py has a license on it."}, {'account_id': 10342, 'date': '2016-11-30 23:19:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

I asked fungi and jeblair about this in #openstack-infra, and according to them[1] this file is generated out of BSD-licensed sphinx code. Until the question of what license this file should have is answered by someone more lawyerly than I, I don't think this patch should merge. Legal-discuss seems to agree[2].

1: http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-infra/%23openstack-infra.2016-11-30.log.html#t2016-11-30T23:10:24
2: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/legal-discuss/2016-October/000442.html"}, {'account_id': 14525, 'date': '2016-12-02 08:37:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2018-01-25 00:48:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

Based on what Jay indicated, the community doesn't think we should do this. I'm putting a -2 so people don't think that this is ready to be merged.

If the community thinks otherwise, let me know and I'll remove the -2.

Thanks for submitting the patch."}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2018-01-25 00:49:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

ARGH. Jay already had -2'd this. I'm going to abandon it, then I wouldn't have looked at it. Feel free to un-abandon it if things change. Thanks."}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2018-01-25 00:50:12.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Because the community doesn't think we should do this and I don't want this visible when going through patches to review."}]

Not all services are supported by OSP. We need to make it clear in the
environments directory so our users can know it.
It's suggested to take a look at
https://access.redhat.com/articles/1535373 before any OSP deployment to
make sure that services are actually supported by Red Hat.

Change-Id: I2239d3e63f1062b9e529b42d763770b6d0d972e7

commit_message:
environments: document OSP deployments

Not all services are supported by OSP. We need to make it clear in the
environments directory so our users can know it.
It's suggested to take a look at
https://access.redhat.com/articles/1535373 before any OSP deployment to
make sure that services are actually supported by Red Hat.

Change-Id: I2239d3e63f1062b9e529b42d763770b6d0d972e7

commit_message:
Change from new engine facade to old nested transaction for OVO

The new engine facade is proved to not work well with OVO's
nested transaction style, see bug/1706750 for more details.

In order to support (Distributed) Port Binding OVO transition in
plugins/ml2/plugin.py, a temporary solution is to revert back to
old nested transaction style.

Change-Id: Ie926b02a31fff17e110aefd27675496e3d2fc9e4
Closes-Bug: #1744829

Use "driver_handles_share_servers=True" backend driver.
When create service neutron port to connect with service instances,
we should set the port security group is disable, to prevent be added
the default security group in neutron. Because some cases the default
security group would lead to the port can not connect with the service
instances.

Change-Id: Ib13e4f80c5a54b2b863b511ebb6e8f82700a3639

commit_message:
Disable security group rule when create port

Use "driver_handles_share_servers=True" backend driver.
When create service neutron port to connect with service instances,
we should set the port security group is disable, to prevent be added
the default security group in neutron. Because some cases the default
security group would lead to the port can not connect with the service
instances.

Change-Id: Ib13e4f80c5a54b2b863b511ebb6e8f82700a3639
Closes-Bug:#1720283
(cherry picked from commit 3c3d899837e256d4692c4195f0e77ff600817e5c)

subject: Do not apply format expansions to passwords
messages: [{'account_id': 2, 'date': '2017-12-05 21:08:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8116, 'date': '2017-12-06 14:19:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1\n\nLooks good to me :-) I didn't realize the code from os-client-config was copied over here, thanks for picking up on this."}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2017-12-11 14:57:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-01-24 17:57:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-01-24 22:19:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-05 21:08:18.000000000', 'message': 'Do not apply format expansions to passwords

get_one_cloud() and get_one_cloud_osc() iterate over config
values and try to expand any variables in those values by
calling value.format(), however some config values
(e.g. password) should never have format() applied to them, not
only might that change the password but it will also cause the
format() function to raise an exception if it can not parse the
format string. Examples would be single brace (e.g. 'foo{')
which raises an ValueError because it's looking for a matching
end brace or a brace pair with a key value that cannot be found
(e.g. 'foo{bar}') which raises a KeyError.

It is not reasonsable to try to escape any braces because:

1) Escaping all braces breaks valid use of the format string syntax.

2) Trying to determine exactly which braces should be escaped and
which should be preserved is a daunting task and likely would not be
robust.

3) Some strings might look like valid format syntax but still should
be escaped (e.g. "foo{bar}", if this appeared in a password we
wouldn't escape it and there would be a key error on the 'bar' key.

4) In general passwords should never be modified, you never want to
apply formatting to them.

The right approach is to maintain a list of config values which are
excluded from having formatting applied to them. At the moment that
list just includes 'password' but perhaps down the road other
exceptions might crop up. This patch follows this approach,
the list of excluded values can easily be updated if others are
discovered.

Change-Id: I187bdec582d4c2cc6c7fda47a1538194137c616b
Closes-Bug: 1635696
Signed-off-by: John Dennis <jdennis@redhat.com>

excluded from having formatting applied to them. At the moment that
list just includes 'password' but perhaps down the road other
exceptions might crop up. This patch follows this approach,
the list of excluded values can easily be updated if others are
discovered.

commit_message:
Do not apply format expansions to passwords

get_one_cloud() and get_one_cloud_osc() iterate over config
values and try to expand any variables in those values by
calling value.format(), however some config values
(e.g. password) should never have format() applied to them, not
only might that change the password but it will also cause the
format() function to raise an exception if it can not parse the
format string. Examples would be single brace (e.g. 'foo{')
which raises an ValueError because it's looking for a matching
end brace or a brace pair with a key value that cannot be found
(e.g. 'foo{bar}') which raises a KeyError.

It is not reasonsable to try to escape any braces because:

1) Escaping all braces breaks valid use of the format string syntax.

2) Trying to determine exactly which braces should be escaped and
which should be preserved is a daunting task and likely would not be
robust.

3) Some strings might look like valid format syntax but still should
be escaped (e.g. "foo{bar}", if this appeared in a password we
wouldn't escape it and there would be a key error on the 'bar' key.

4) In general passwords should never be modified, you never want to
apply formatting to them.

The right approach is to maintain a list of config values which are
excluded from having formatting applied to them. At the moment that
list just includes 'password' but perhaps down the road other
exceptions might crop up. This patch follows this approach,
the list of excluded values can easily be updated if others are
discovered.

Change-Id: I187bdec582d4c2cc6c7fda47a1538194137c616b
Closes-Bug: 1635696
Signed-off-by: John Dennis <jdennis@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Initial OSA zuul v3 role jobs

This patch implements an initial set of jobs intended to match
the current job execution method. It does not intend to improve
how the jobs are executed - only to replicate what is currently
in openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs and provide the platform
to iterate on.

Change-Id: I3fe6e25c820a66ab7bf0a42a7c49b665734c3b37

commit_message:
Swift 404s to raise NotFound correctly

* `head_data_by_id` was not correctly calling
   exceptions.raise_from_response for HEAD
   requests. This meant that calls to resources that
   support HEAD would create dummy resource objects
   even when a 404 was returned rather than raise
   the NotFound exception.
* object_store.obj had a custom get function that
  didn't use exceptions.raise_from_response as per the
  standard resource.get function.

Change-Id: If240404b66f0f851e2438e46b9004bb6226f0670

commit_message:
Use YAML inventory for minor update

This makes sure we can correctly handle multiline strings. The
previous ini format was quite limited in what it could handle, and
multiline strings broke it.

Change-Id: I9ee83f81eaf49b16fb4002bf8d7a3ecb4fe1553d
Closes-Bug: #1744003

I'm of two minds here as backporting deprecations that disable the semantics of existing parameters seem a bit wrong. On the other hand this is strictly for tripleo and appears to resolve an actual issue."}, {'account_id': 21909, 'date': '2018-01-23 23:45:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I'm of two minds here as backporting deprecations that disable the
 > semantics of existing parameters seem a bit wrong. On the other
 > hand this is strictly for tripleo and appears to resolve an actual
 > issue.

Yeah the issue, for example with keepalived, is that the interface can't be expanded to include additional networks so a new mechanism had to be used to include these vips, and the same mechanism is used with haproxy.  Its feasible to maintain all of the old code using the old hiera values but this seems like a good use of deprecation.  There are no plans to backport this to any versions older than Pike, which is where composable networks was introduced."}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-01-24 05:52:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Configure VIPs for all networks including composable networks

Configure all VIPs including those on custom composable networks.
Hard-coded network names are removed and instead a hiera parameter
containing all networks is used.

For keepalived, the vrouter_id is generated from an index for each
network in the hiera data.  This will change the vrouter_ids for
some VIPs.

Change-Id: I117454afe750451ad1f2633fa0f196bb71740b8d
Partial-Bug: 1741129
Depends-On: If8d3219a0714e3db34980e884dce84912a837865
(cherry picked from commit 5824044527b347b67a754834c2db46406acf3b0d)

commit_message:
Add composable network VIPs for puppet configuration

Adds new hiera parameters for VIPs for all isolated networks including
any custom composable networks.  The existing hard-coded network parameters
can be removed when the puppet-tripleo change
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/531037 merges that no longer uses them.

The new network_virtual_ips paramater contains the network name, vip, and
an index used to generate the vrouter_id in puppet-tripleo.

Change-Id: If8d3219a0714e3db34980e884dce84912a837865
Partial-Bug: 1741129
(cherry picked from commit 749a99a5cd53d4c5308e38f97f6d2d1439a262ad)

commit_message:
Add yaml validations for FFU.

A new set of tasks are being added,
the 'fast_forward_upgrade_tasks', which
share structure with 'upgrade_tasks' hence
the same set of validations are being applied
to check the correct tasks structure.

Change-Id: I26898e2df68d80d0721e0467c5220f34835f6ba4

This was never meant to be wired in unless a user
overrides it.

commit_message:
Ensure packages for octavia only when EnablePackageInstall is True

Changing the ansible task for ensuring packages to run only when
EnablePackageInstall is True.
Also removed the step4 tag from this task as there are no tags
in host_prep_tasks.

Change-Id: I1374b20ec66694fe661183e089f8d88473be11a9

And also, could you propose the tempest patch in the new repo also, so that they can be tested'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-01-19 22:41:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-01-20 06:48:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

(6 comments)

Thanks Anusha. I stripped the tempest stuff back out of this patch. I proposed the tempest tests in an in-tree tempest patch just so we can see it passes (but we don't intend to merge that): https://review.openstack.org/#/c/535985/

Separately, I'll propose a tempest patch to the congress tempest plugin repo."}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-01-20 06:52:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

Started having strange error in py27 HA tests today in all patches. Quite clearly unrelated to the changes. We'll have to figure out the problem, but shouldn't hold us back from reviewing this patch in the mean time.

PE instance fails to start because of the following error:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "congress/server/congress_server.py", line 27, in <module>
    from oslo_log import log as logging
  File "/home/zuul/src/git.openstack.org/openstack/congress/.tox/py27/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/oslo_log/log.py", line 48, in <module>
    from oslo_log import formatters
  File "/home/zuul/src/git.openstack.org/openstack/congress/.tox/py27/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/oslo_log/formatters.py", line 29, in <module>
    from oslo_serialization import jsonutils
  File "/home/zuul/src/git.openstack.org/openstack/congress/.tox/py27/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/oslo_serialization/jsonutils.py", line 43, in <module>
    from oslo_utils import timeutils
  File "/home/zuul/src/git.openstack.org/openstack/congress/.tox/py27/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/oslo_utils/timeutils.py", line 27, in <module>
    from monotonic import monotonic as now  # noqa
  File "/home/zuul/src/git.openstack.org/openstack/congress/.tox/py27/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/monotonic.py", line 169, in <module>
    raise RuntimeError('no suitable implementation for this system: ' + repr(e))
RuntimeError: no suitable implementation for this system: ImportError('cannot import name log',)'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-01-23 01:59:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-01-23 02:11:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-01-23 02:22:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-01-23 04:04:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2018-01-23 05:37:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16:

@Eric, the same problem is seen with aodh also, py35 tests failing because some change needed in aodh project, we are skipping aodh tests for py35 as its not py35 compatible, or we can enable them and make py35 tests non-voting, but second option doesn't sound good, as the failure is not happening in our code.
So im inclined to skipping tests instead."}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2018-01-23 05:38:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

@Eric, why the actions have been disabled again , any reason?'}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2018-01-23 05:46:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

ok, saw your comment on the other patch. missed before'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-01-23 05:55:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16:

Why actions and action_executions tables have been disable:
I realized that given standard congress use case as overall administration, it made more sense to for the tables to include things from all projects not just to currently querying one. But it turns out listing for all projects is not supported for actions and action executions, only for workflows and workflow executions. So to avoid inconsistency where some tables are for all projects and others not, I disabled the actions and action executions tables for now.

My thinking it in the future we can ask mistral to support all_projects in actions API and then we can add those tables back in a backward compatible way.

We can also add an optional datasource config option 'all_projects' that defaults to True. That way if someone wants to deploy in a different way (showing only things belonging to a particular project), s/he can do that too by overriding the option to False."}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-01-23 06:08:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16:

I see about aodh. The thing is, both mistral and mistral-client seems to be working just fine in py35. It's only the mistral tempest test client that needed some tweaking."}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2018-01-23 06:13:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

@Eric, same with aodh, aodh service client needs the change http://logs.openstack.org/33/533133/16/check/congress-devstack-py35-api-mysql/afcb099/logs/testr_results.html.gz'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-01-23 06:27:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

For me, since both congress and mistral claim to support py35 and they do work fine, it makes more sense to enable the test, even it means duplicating some testing code.

By duplicating the service client code in tempest test, the worst that can happen is our test breaks at some point down the road and then we need to spend some time fixing it (maybe by switching to importing from mistral-tempest-plugin.

By skipping the test, we may introduce changes that break mistral driver under py35 unknowingly. Seems worse.'}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2018-01-23 06:37:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16:

@Eric, I don't recommend duplicating other projects code in our repo. At some point of time, it becomes too outdated, and very hard to check where it broke. Once merged, no one keeps track on what is changed or not. So, its always better to use their code which will be uptodate.
And less burden of maintenance if something breaks 

And also , if we go with this approach, aodh service client also needs to be added to our repo, fixing their py35 issue? Im not sure it would be good approach and unnecessary effort."}, {'account_id': 18955, 'date': '2018-01-23 06:50:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-01-23 23:47:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

Thanks dharmendra kushwaha. I can remove the inactive code if we decide to merge this patch.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-01-23 23:59:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

Ok sorry this is a bit confusing, but I proposed an alternative mistral driver patch here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/536999/

We can decide which one makes more sense. Typically, the primary use case for Congress datasource is to monitor and manage the overall state of the datacenter over all projects. But in the case of Mistral, it may be more commonly used to trigger and monitor workflows/actions for the admin project. The two use cases are described in more detail in the commit message of the alternative patch.

This patch defaults to all_projects which is suitable for monitoring and managing all mistral workflows across all projects.

The alternative patch defaults to single project which is suitable for managing the admin workflows used to manage the datacenter. It also adds the datasource config option to operate in all_projects mode. The deployer has the option to instantiate one mistral datasource for the admin project and another mistral datasource for all projects.

My own preference is to go with the alternative patch, and I want to hear what others think.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-01-24 06:10:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-01-24 06:28:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17:

@Anusha

I updated the driver as we discussed. Now not attempting to use all_projects. It's been tested on my devstack. Also tempest tests here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/535985/

Please merge when satisfactory. Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2018-01-24 07:28:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2018-01-24 07:37:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: Published edit on patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-01-24 07:53:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 19.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-01-24 07:55:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 19:

oops didn't see that you fixed it already. well I fixed it again."}, {'account_id': 11278, 'date': '2018-01-24 10:31:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-01-24 17:17:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

Removing this patch from dependency, then merging: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/533248/'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-01-24 17:18:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 20.'}, {'account_id': 18591, 'date': '2018-01-24 17:18:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Mistral driver

Mistral driver and unit tests. Allows congress to
create workflows and trigger execution in Mistral.

Also configures mistral for gate integration tests.
Tempest tests in separate patch.

Implements blueprint add-mistral-driver

Change-Id: I79d3b9c2f659302f43164d5eef3b23ddf2f2d056

commit_message:
Split docker mirror and debug configs

Use augeas to modify only parameters' dedicated configuration.
Split mirror configs from debug configs. Overlapping those params may
cause augeas errors and/or nschedule the docker service restarts for
some cases, ending up with  split brain state for the docker
service run-time config vs changed docker-daemon.json config.

Follows-up Ic5640061837b022f7175f0db0dc269f9a61e6023

Change-Id: I7932aa2e0eb096ea09255084783e577bb450e0cd
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add endpoint for ODL

Add ODL endpoint and use it to get ODL port. Public access to
ODL is not allowed and hence the public endpoint is missing.
Internal endpoint is used for all internal communication and
TLS is enabled for that.

Change-Id: I66af960c6732f5d2efa8ea2db28cad122e321999

commit_message:
bgpvpn: agent extension support for Port advertise_fixed_ips

The port fixed IP are advertised if there is at least
one Port association with advertise_fixed_ip True, or
a Network association, or a Router association.

Change-Id: I8b650dca2b219e10fda64a786f0bf9d601749bc2
Partially-Implements: blueprint routes-control

commit_message:
NetApp cDOT: Add NVE support in Manila

NVE is a software-based technology for encrypting
data at rest one volume at a time. An encryption
key, accessible only to the storage system,
ensures that volume data cannot be read if the
underlying device is repurposed, returned,
misplaced or stolen.

Signed-off-by: Erlon R. Cruz <erlon@netapp.com>
Signed-off-by: Tiago Pasqualini <tiagod@netapp.com>

Change-Id: Ib622c3d64cbec5a7254f6074f07d6f56f6492ca4
Implements: blueprint netapp-encrypted-shares

commit_message:
Release python-cinderclient 3.5.0

This is the final release for the Queens release.

It includes some bug fixes, a MV compatibility bump to
3.50 and dependency changes, therefore, justifying it
as a feature bump.

Includes creation of the branch for stable/queens.

Change-Id: I2179f74fffe25032f385bbea330ee4cf3074e74c

commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: ensure instance id uniqueness

Fix a how instance ids are allocated, to ensure that
two VPN instance do not end up using the same id.

Yes, this is appalling.

Change-Id: I474834340751d05ae33b6eb8404511e23f110598
Closes-Bug: 1745145

commit_message:
Add resource2/proxy2 wrappers with deprecations

Folks out there who may have resources subclassing resource2 will be
broken by the removal and rename back to resource. Add a resource2 and a
proxy2 that emits a deprecation warning from the constructor but
otherwise just subclasses resource and proxy.

While doing that, do the same thing for enable_logging which moved.

Change-Id: I76a3c9c3172942069b1e740189af530f35f41a1c

commit_message:
Rename resource2 and proxy2 to resource and proxy

This caps off a bunch of work to get to the new and improved
Resouce2/Proxy2 interfaces. All of the services have been migrated and
the old classes have been removed. Rename openstack.resource2 to
openstack.resource and openstack.proxy2 to openstack.proxy.

Change-Id: I0b7e1c679358e1f60b5316a255aad3a59fbbc8a9

commit_message:
Remove resource and proxy

Step one in the final removal of resource/proxy v1. Doing it as a
two commit chain just as a sanity check.

All of the services have been migrated to Resource2/Proxy2. Before we
rename those back to Resource/Proxy, delete the v1 versions and make
sure everything is still happy.

The next patch will do the renames.

Change-Id: I254a7474236ea4959db1bd00b397320b0ca27387

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-15 23:47:23.000000000', 'message': 'Update type conversion to handle subtypes more better

We have pretty much enough information in the Component declarations to
handle arbitrarily nested data descriptions. That's super cool. The only
thing we're missing is dealing with lists of declared types - and of
transparently handling sub-resources.

Resource objects want their construction parameters handed to them as
**kwargs arguments. So we need to figure out if the source data is a
dict and the target types is a Component, so we can pass the values to
the type constructor with **.

For lists, introduce a new Component parameter "list_type" which
declares the type of list in question. We could probably swing around
and make our own parameterizable List formatter and make this go away.
For now, this is easy enough.

The results can be seen with compute.v2.limits - the custom get method
can (almost completely) go away, since the type declaration can just
handle it for us.

Change-Id: Ieb5c3b60853000101504b82f1cd01b1a25370bf1

handle it for us.

commit_message:
Update type conversion to handle subtypes more better

We have pretty much enough information in the Component declarations to
handle arbitrarily nested data descriptions. That's super cool. The only
thing we're missing is dealing with lists of declared types - and of
transparently handling sub-resources.

Resource objects want their construction parameters handed to them as
**kwargs arguments. So we need to figure out if the source data is a
dict and the target types is a Component, so we can pass the values to
the type constructor with **.

For lists, introduce a new Component parameter "list_type" which
declares the type of list in question. We could probably swing around
and make our own parameterizable List formatter and make this go away.
For now, this is easy enough.

The results can be seen with compute.v2.limits - the custom get method
can (almost completely) go away, since the type declaration can just
handle it for us.

Change-Id: Ieb5c3b60853000101504b82f1cd01b1a25370bf1

subject: Update docs and pep8 tox environments
messages: [{'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-01-24 11:42:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-01-24 11:44:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3099, 'date': '2018-01-24 19:51:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-24 11:42:32.000000000', 'message': "Update docs and pep8 tox environments

Make the docs tox environment use doc/requirements.

For pep8, just install the linters and skip installing the package.
Doing this but leaving in the constraints file keeps us in line with
upper-constraints on linters but lets our pep8 envs be tiny.

Finally, remove the doc8 line-length setting. It's not a big enough
difference to warrant changing it.

Change-Id: I3df81474fb52e2587d22c7789b6b553139eb37f2
"}, {'created': '2018-01-24 11:44:02.000000000', 'message': "Update docs and pep8 tox environments

Make the docs tox environment use doc/requirements.

For pep8, just install the linters and skip installing the package.
Doing this but leaving in the constraints file keeps us in line with
upper-constraints on linters but lets our pep8 envs be tiny.

Finally, remove the doc8 line-length setting. It's not a big enough
difference to warrant changing it.

Change-Id: I3df81474fb52e2587d22c7789b6b553139eb37f2
"}]
commit_message:
Update docs and pep8 tox environments

Make the docs tox environment use doc/requirements.

For pep8, just install the linters and skip installing the package.
Doing this but leaving in the constraints file keeps us in line with
upper-constraints on linters but lets our pep8 envs be tiny.

Finally, remove the doc8 line-length setting. It's not a big enough
difference to warrant changing it.

Change-Id: I3df81474fb52e2587d22c7789b6b553139eb37f2

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-06 19:00:16.000000000', 'message': "Add multiattach policy

This patch add the policy for creating and retyping volumes
with volume types that indicate multi attach capabilities.

We use policy to control the use of this particular type,
and we also limit the ability to retype a volumes
multi attach settings to only volumes that are in available
status.  We need to to do this because multi attach has
implications for things on the Compute side (ie libvirt)
that would require detach/reattach to keep things synced
correctly.

Currently there's no back end reporting the `mulitattach=True`
capability, that will be in the next patch of this series.

Change-Id: I3fd8afe9cbae3c733a6530dce7be6fef8d53cfa6
blueprint: multi-attach-v3-attach

"}, {'created': '2018-01-11 17:21:15.000000000', 'message': "Add multiattach policy

This patch adds the policy for creating and retyping volumes
with volume types that indicate multi attach capabilities.

There are two policies being added:

1. MULTIATTACH_POLICY
General policy to disallow creating volumes of type multiattach
as well as retyping volumes to/from a multiattach type.

2. BOOTABLE_MULTIATTACH_POLICY
Specific policy to disallow creating multiple attachments for
any volume that is `bootable`.

We use policy to control the use of this particular type,
and we also limit the ability to retype a volumes
multi attach settings to only volumes that are in available
status.  We need to to do this because multi attach has
implications for things on the Compute side (ie libvirt)
that would require detach/reattach to keep things synced
correctly.

Currently there's no back end reporting the `mulitattach=True`
capability, that will be in the next patch of this series.

Change-Id: I3fd8afe9cbae3c733a6530dce7be6fef8d53cfa6
blueprint: multi-attach-v3-attach
"}, {'created': '2018-01-11 17:36:54.000000000', 'message': "Add multiattach policy

This patch adds the policy for creating and retyping volumes
with volume types that indicate multi attach capabilities.

There are two policies being added:

1. MULTIATTACH_POLICY
General policy to disallow creating volumes of type multiattach
as well as retyping volumes to/from a multiattach type.

2. BOOTABLE_MULTIATTACH_POLICY
Specific policy to disallow creating multiple attachments for
any volume that is `bootable`.

We use policy to control the use of this particular type,
and we also limit the ability to retype a volumes
multi attach settings to only volumes that are in available
status.  We need to to do this because multi attach has
implications for things on the Compute side (ie libvirt)
that would require detach/reattach to keep things synced
correctly.

Currently there's no back end reporting the `mulitattach=True`

"}, {'created': '2018-01-15 18:11:34.000000000', 'message': "Add multiattach policy

This patch adds the policy for creating and retyping volumes
with volume types that indicate multi attach capabilities.

There are two policies being added:

1. MULTIATTACH_POLICY
General policy to disallow creating volumes of type multiattach
as well as retyping volumes to/from a multiattach type.

2. MULTIATTACH_BOOTABLE_VOLUME_POLICY
Specific policy to disallow creating multiple attachments for
any volume that is `bootable`.

We use policy to control the use of this particular type,
and we also limit the ability to retype a volumes
multi attach settings to only volumes that are in available
status.  We need to to do this because multi attach has
implications for things on the Compute side (ie libvirt)
that would require detach/reattach to keep things synced
correctly.

Currently there's no back end reporting the `multiattach=True`
capability, that will be in the next patch of this series.

commit_message:
Add multiattach policy

This patch adds the policy for creating and retyping volumes
with volume types that indicate multi attach capabilities.

There are two policies being added:

1. MULTIATTACH_POLICY
General policy to disallow creating volumes of type multiattach
as well as retyping volumes to/from a multiattach type.

2. MULTIATTACH_BOOTABLE_VOLUME_POLICY
Specific policy to disallow creating multiple attachments for
any volume that is `bootable`.

We use policy to control the use of this particular type,
and we also limit the ability to retype a volumes
multi attach settings to only volumes that are in available
status.  We need to to do this because multi attach has
implications for things on the Compute side (ie libvirt)
that would require detach/reattach to keep things synced
correctly.

Currently there's no back end reporting the `multiattach=True`
capability, that will be in the next patch of this series.

Change-Id: I3fd8afe9cbae3c733a6530dce7be6fef8d53cfa6
blueprint: multi-attach-v3-attach

commit_message:
Build Common Framework for Feature Classification Matrix

The feature classification matrix will provide information about
plugins and the features they support. Acts as a launching point for
users to ready to deploy their cloud. Users can use the matrix to find
features and plugins that meet their
needs.

Pulling out the framework from Nova's implementation here:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/support-matrix.html

Neutron and Nova are currently working on implementation.

Putting the extension in its own module will give all projects a common
framework to use.

Co-Authored-By: <ankur.gupta@intel.com>
Change-Id: Icf4975b1dafefc9ba9f063bd8f9c6c54a36c1e13

commit_message:
Shift doc requirements to doc/requirements.txt

This is the new hotness.

Add doc8 linting to the pep8 target while we're doing it. And, slim down
pep8 tox env. It doesn't need to install shade or any of the
requirements.

Change-Id: I1e73ee503c81f92b4fe84bdd384f856290b6d5dd

base for the tempest tests.

Change-Id: I266d64a7b3ba2f2a283596399662e71d8a021325
"}]
commit_message:
Make tempest native Zuul v3 jobs

As part of the migration to Zuul v3 jobs should be converted to native
versions. This patch uses `devstack-tempest`'s native job to provide a
base for the tempest tests.

Change-Id: I266d64a7b3ba2f2a283596399662e71d8a021325

commit_message:
use multiprovidernet api definition from neutron-lib

The multiprovidernet API extension's definition was rehomed into
neutron-lib with If3367e6a14074a6225bba527e8f7e38c51280f85 and will be
consumed in neutron via I12c15c360f8bf5a45fbe70e5ed1202ef0e7ec0f0

This patch switches the code over to use neutron-lib's multiprovidernet
API definition rather than neutron's extension.

Change-Id: I129934d653d0e712bced6c9af5d301b5a24d3a79

commit_message:
Allow API user to define list of versions

In cases where one may need to support multiple API
micro-versions, it makes sense to allow a user to submit
the list of versions their code can support, as long as
they have the visibility into that version.

Adds the ability to pass in a list to the
os_ironic_api_version value during client
initialization, and facilitate the negotiation
of the highest available version.

Change-Id: I0dfa3f7fe0a1e2aaf31d37c46b65cc6c064b5e86
Related-Bug: #1739440
Related-Bug: #1671145

[{'created': '2017-11-15 23:09:38.000000000', 'message': "remove sample sorting

this does nothing. the listener currently consumes events across
all queues, drops them into an 'incoming' queue. from here, a thread
batches them based on batch options. the batched messages themselves
are still in order and therefore sorting it does nothing.

the only reason it'd be out of order is if a message was requeue'd.
in this case, sorting will probably do nothing since the requeue'd location
is probably not remotely close to original ordering and will probably
never be batched with same messages to sort correctly.

Change-Id: I6faa97bb90bee00ec94f4faf622822ea93655efb

commit_message:
remove sample sorting

this does nothing. the listener currently consumes events across
all queues, drops them into an 'incoming' queue. from here, a thread
batches them based on batch options. the batched messages themselves
are still in order and therefore sorting it does nothing.

the only reason it'd be out of order is if a message was requeue'd.
in this case, sorting will probably do nothing since the requeue'd location
is probably not remotely close to original ordering and will probably
never be batched with same messages to sort correctly.

Change-Id: I6faa97bb90bee00ec94f4faf622822ea93655efb

commit_message:
Simplify the ssh tests and where it gets it's key from

We shouldn't need to make a distinction between CI and local run. CI
should now properly use a home directory.

Change-Id: Ie8c20203fc31b1ba9a5b3fdcd20654562d894a10
Depends-On: I10c06d3fb644c7e3026eac7a00660f0465fb0749

subject: WIP: Added "request_ids" attribute to objects for glance APIs.
messages:
[{'account_id': 20182, 'date': '2017-06-27 13:11:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20182, 'date': '2017-06-27 13:12:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 8257, 'date': '2017-06-27 13:15:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Just look in the log files for the IDs.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-06-27 13:45:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

Build failed (check pipeline).  For information on how to proceed, see http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html#automated-testing

- gate-python-openstacksdk-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://docs-draft.openstack.org/43/478143/1/check/gate-python-openstacksdk-docs-ubuntu-xenial/3654d88//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 38s
- gate-python-openstacksdk-pep8-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/43/478143/1/check/gate-python-openstacksdk-pep8-ubuntu-xenial/dc76c64/ : SUCCESS in 0s
- gate-python-openstacksdk-python27-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/43/478143/1/check/gate-python-openstacksdk-python27-ubuntu-xenial/0886334/ : FAILURE in 1m 09s
- gate-python-openstacksdk-python35 http://logs.openstack.org/43/478143/1/check/gate-python-openstacksdk-python35/784b01e/ : FAILURE in 1m 05s
- gate-python-openstacksdk-pypy http://logs.openstack.org/43/478143/1/check/gate-python-openstacksdk-pypy/e6c43a5/ : FAILURE in 0s (non-voting)
- gate-sdk-dsvm-functional-ubuntu-xenial-nv http://logs.openstack.org/43/478143/1/check/gate-sdk-dsvm-functional-ubuntu-xenial-nv/ee04f3e/ : SUCCESS in 20m 28s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 20182, 'date': '2017-06-28 13:19:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Brain, Thanks For review.

Actually, there is the cross spec [1] submitted to return "request_id" to the user from python-clients,
so just proposing same thing in the python-openstacksdk. Means whenever the object is return by the python-openstacksdk
the additional "request_id" attribute will be return by the object.

As we had discussed earlier [2] launchpad bug is submitted to returned the "request_id" and implementation is done against it.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/156508

[2]: http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-sdks/%23openstack-sdks.2016-03-22.log.html'}, {'account_id': 8257, 'date': '2017-06-28 14:21:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yeah, I just don't see that validating the need to add this complexity and maintenance cost. If you need to look back at what went wrong in a call to an API you can get the details out of the log file. That's 100% of the reason the logging exists."}, {'account_id': 20182, 'date': '2017-07-07 09:47:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Brian,

Thanks for your response, Yeah, we can get the details of request_id from log file if log_level is configured as DEBUG but it's not recommended 
in the production environment. Hence, we want to return request_id to the user for troubleshooting any problem with the service provider."}, {'account_id': 8257, 'date': '2017-07-07 20:52:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I still don't see the need to programmatically expose request IDs on a response object in this manner. What are you even going to do with them? Now you have them on an object and you need to do a bunch of handling to see if it's a good object, then if it's not you have to write a bunch of handling to put the corresponding request ID somewhere. You're probably going to write it to a log file anyway. Plus, if a call actually fails in some way, we likely raised an exception and don't end up returning a response anyway for a request ID to come out of anyway. If you need it before the exception you'd have to do this in the keystoneauth session (which we subclass).

Maybe you could have keystoneauth log request IDs and the corresponding URI that was requested? That's probably doable at an info level, without requiring the full cURL debugging info. That's also unintrusive, useful, and easily maintainable.

Another reason I'm very strongly against this is because if you're going to do it you have to do it all over, and that would mean you need to add decorators to over 650 public methods. That won't be approved."}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-18 02:54:39.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jenkins with the following votes:

* Verified-1 by Jenkins (3)
'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-01-24 19:49:20.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

I agree with Brian - this isn't a thing that's going to be able to land - the info is available via the keystoneauth logs, and the request-id isn't actually an attribute of the resources."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-06-27 13:11:54.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Added "request_ids" attribute to objects for glance APIs.

This patch returns "request_ids" for all image APIs and partial APIs
of other services like compute, cinder etc because the changes are made
in common file openstack/resource2.py which affects calls made to
create, list, update and get methods from the base "Resource" class.

Our plan is to add request_ids attribute for API calls made to
the cinder, image, identity and compute services.
I will submit more patches to return request_ids for compute,
cinder and identity API calls.

For example:

"conn" is the connection object to connect image service

get_image = conn.image.get_image(image-id)
print("get image request_ids======= %s" % get_image.request_ids)

Output:

get image request_ids======= ['req-a64bd8c1-da5b-44fa-8f58-d7ea5163e514']

DocImpact: Return response object of all APIs will contain additional
"request_ids" attribute

Closes-Bug: 1568776
Change-Id: Ia877e6c2b2860be108c332960111346741e0d739
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: Added "request_ids" attribute to objects for glance APIs.

This patch returns "request_ids" for all image APIs and partial APIs
of other services like compute, cinder etc because the changes are made
in common file openstack/resource2.py which affects calls made to
create, list, update and get methods from the base "Resource" class.

Our plan is to add request_ids attribute for API calls made to
the cinder, image, identity and compute services.
I will submit more patches to return request_ids for compute,
cinder and identity API calls.

For example:

"conn" is the connection object to connect image service

get_image = conn.image.get_image(image-id)
print("get image request_ids======= %s" % get_image.request_ids)

Output:

get image request_ids======= ['req-a64bd8c1-da5b-44fa-8f58-d7ea5163e514']

DocImpact: Return response object of all APIs will contain additional
"request_ids" attribute

Closes-Bug: 1568776
Change-Id: Ia877e6c2b2860be108c332960111346741e0d739

commit_message:
Disable intersphinx to enable offline documentation building

Loading the intersphinx extension causes Sphinx to fetch
json objects from the internet during the build process, which
isn't possible in some downstream packaging build environments.

Change-Id: I86dc43c0a9dd03f7e797cce60e2bc6a7cc021bb5

commit_message:
Define IpAddressAlreadyAllocated exception

This exception will raise when creating a port with an IP allocated
IP address. This exception needs to be defined in client so that
nova can catch it and perform the error handling.

Needed-By: I5bee9ae18764b6f285ecc5e8d7148a1019c74701
Change-Id: Ie1d4581d334e1ec491e56371c62978945ae24a44
Related-Bug: #1744103

commit_message:
Usage docs and initial release note for osc-placement

This adds the initial usage docs and a release note for the
first set of commands available in what will be the 1.0.0
release for the osc-placement plugin in the Queens series.

There are some other changes to the docs layout:

* The cliff.sphinxext is used to get the CLI reference.
* The README is inlined to the top docs index page.
* The usage doc is changed to the user/index.rst format
  based on the docs.o.o manuals migration spec.
* The ordering of the contents is also changed based on
  the docs.o.o manuals migration spec.
* The modindex is removed since it doesn't exist and since
  there are no python API bindings in this library, we don't
  need a module index anyway.

Depends-On: Id18aab2a95849bc60769f2f81c363c17d049b21f

Part of blueprint placement-osc-plugin

Change-Id: I552688b9ee32b719a576a7a9ed5e4d5aa31d7b3f

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-23 15:50:29.000000000', 'message': 'Address review comments from allocations patch

This addresses some review comments from change
I699fd01d6dbd1c9c5186d1b86499ae2bae94286a:

1. Improve the help text wording for "allocation set" to
   let people know it's an overwrite/replacement of the
   existing allocations so they need to include old and new
   allocations if they don't want to lose the old ones when
   adding any new ones.

2. A couple of enhancements in the allocation unit tests.

Part of blueprint placement-osc-plugin

commit_message:
Address review comments from allocations patch

This addresses some review comments from change
I699fd01d6dbd1c9c5186d1b86499ae2bae94286a:

1. Improve the help text wording for "allocation set" to
   let people know it's an overwrite/replacement of the
   existing allocations so they need to include old and new
   allocations if they don't want to lose the old ones when
   adding any new ones.

2. A couple of enhancements in the allocation unit tests.

Part of blueprint placement-osc-plugin

Change-Id: I4abebc709564d8afcbbe18e8d406f2c898d7ea8b

subject: swift_rsync: don't bind mount /run
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 6968, 'name': 'Christian Schwede', 'email': 'cschwede@redhat.com', 'username': 'cschwede'}, {'_account_id': 13039, 'name': 'Martin André', 'email': 'm.andre@redhat.com', 'username': 'mandre'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26556, 'name': 'SongHao', 'email': 'songhao@gohighsec.com', 'username': 'SongHao'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 360, 'date': '2017-10-18 12:41:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2017-10-18 14:47:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

What was the purpose for bind mounting /run in? Do other containers still need that?'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2017-10-20 16:48:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2017-10-20 16:52:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

bogdan: so I don't think we need these for swift. Just checked and Kolla ansible doesn't either. Other services I dunno. But I would say lets not block getting this in to fix those. Perhaps ask in #kolla or on an email thread?"}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2017-10-23 11:30:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2017-10-27 14:54:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2017-11-06 17:33:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2017-11-13 19:13:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2017-12-02 17:34:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2017-12-02 17:34:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2017-12-04 16:07:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2017-12-20 21:03:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2017-12-21 10:25:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

IIRC the issue was that rsync was still running on the host. It's now disabled on upgrade. Also we now clean up the /var/run/rsyncd.pid file on update.

See:
https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/docker/services/swift-storage.yaml#L524-L534

I'd like storage folks to confirm or not if we need the /run bind mount in swift containers."}, {'account_id': 26556, 'date': '2017-12-25 01:44:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2018-01-21 18:52:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Crickets from the storage team on this...

The "upgrade" scripts don't run in all cases (like re-running an undercloud install). I would still like to land this as I don't think it is needed.'}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2018-01-22 08:02:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

> The "upgrade" scripts don't run in all cases (like re-running an
 > undercloud install). I would still like to land this as I don't
 > think it is needed.

CI seems to agree with you. Still, I would be nice to confirm with the storage squad this is effectively OK to remove the /run mount in all of the swift containers.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-01-22 08:45:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-01-24 09:31:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

reverify'}]

commit_message:
swift_rsync: don't bind mount /run

This resolves an issue where the pid file exists from a previous
run of the container.

Change-Id: Id051172407f0e879d3edf18c8b2ec13734794ed2
Closes-bug: #1724559

commit_message:
Adds the missing stats command and fixes status

Stats and status are treated differently then the other
resources and don't require the unwrap-treatment but
need to be passed through - this adds this capability.

Change-Id: I4b9a95b1efccdd1e9aab657a50d24bae32cf41b5
Story: 2001383

messages: [{'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2018-01-23 20:12:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2018-01-24 15:56:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2018-01-24 17:11:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-23 20:12:09.000000000', 'message': "Don't override oslo.db tweaks for connection pool in tests

This is in a way a follow-up for
Ia97d6cf24e554f7b3878dd301ae4e7e10a1c9998 that removed the same in
production neutron code to rely on default values inherited from
oslo.db. There is no clear need to override those settings in test
environment either, so at best it's boilerplate code.

Related-Bug: #1682307
Change-Id: Ie2e2dd0659b1cd6d8b8480e2d78d00475ab01b40
"}]
commit_message:
Don't override oslo.db tweaks for connection pool in tests

This is in a way a follow-up for
Ia97d6cf24e554f7b3878dd301ae4e7e10a1c9998 that removed the same in
production neutron code to rely on default values inherited from
oslo.db. There is no clear need to override those settings in test
environment either, so at best it's boilerplate code.

Related-Bug: #1682307
Change-Id: Ie2e2dd0659b1cd6d8b8480e2d78d00475ab01b40

commit_message:
Adjust deprecated nova placement variables

The `os_interface` and `os_region_name` variables have been
deprecated during the Queens release.

`os_interface` has now changed to a list of valid interfaces called
`valid_interfaces`. The internal URL is chosen by default.

`os_region_name` is now `region_name`.

Closes-Bug: 1742706
Change-Id: If79b15c114c766e784857a6d97e5fb4072809bb7

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-23 13:33:44.000000000', 'message': 'Remove use of unsupported TEMPEST_SERVICES variable

TEMPEST_SERVICES global variable is not supported
by devstack since long back.
- I380dd20e5ed716a0bdf92aa02c3730359b8136e4
- I9c24705e494689f09a885eb0a640efd50db33fcf

Service availability of tempest known services will be
set by devstack with local check.
- I02be777bf93143d946ccbb8e9eff637bfd1928d4

searchlight-ui does not have tempest plugin so it does
not need to have service register in tempest.

This commit removes the TEMPEST_SERVICES
setting.

Change-Id: Ia672f63eabecb3f7d39c6d642db5742b5f9c08bb
Related-Bug: #1743688
'}]
commit_message:
Remove use of unsupported TEMPEST_SERVICES variable

TEMPEST_SERVICES global variable is not supported
by devstack since long back.
- I380dd20e5ed716a0bdf92aa02c3730359b8136e4
- I9c24705e494689f09a885eb0a640efd50db33fcf

Service availability of tempest known services will be
set by devstack with local check.
- I02be777bf93143d946ccbb8e9eff637bfd1928d4

searchlight-ui does not have tempest plugin so it does
not need to have service register in tempest.

This commit removes the TEMPEST_SERVICES
setting.

Change-Id: Ia672f63eabecb3f7d39c6d642db5742b5f9c08bb
Related-Bug: #1743688

commit_message:
Add IPv6 support to scenario tests

This patch complements I4ca727f92618998242af18908bbbda6bb5f86303
by adding IPv6 functionality to scenario tests.

Also, as described in I4ca727f92618998242af18908bbbda6bb5f86303,
this change is also adding a new test config option to override
NFS access rules.

Change-Id: Id8b005cdd429d53a75624885fe7ca795746c3ede

commit_message:
Revert recent floating ip "improvements"

Something has gone south with deleting servers and floating ips. Revert
the stack related to this.

Don't delete the tests though- turns out we really need them!

Revert "Fix delete_ips on delete_server and add tests"

This reverts commit 74522a1a224a5379649645ad57e916fe003638bd.

Revert "Don't fail hard on 404 from neutron FIP listing"

This reverts commit 6334250493624aa56a7062c394442026dea5dfca.

Revert "Only search for floating ips if the server has them"

This reverts commit 45e689942676f52f5a405262b41c0d60a0d681ab.

Revert "Don't try to delete fips on non-fip clouds"

This reverts commit 2486e09b67c20254f780a1f2cee941c4345553d1.

Revert "Return an empty list on FIP listing failure"

This reverts commit 10beaf9c43a19220b61b7e979f6e46f0056410c5.

Revert "Do less work when deleting a server and floating ips"

This reverts commit c97bac299751775294e8abc5f01d1bfb7bb681cf.

Change-Id: Ib76a5900c02d81039aa9f033993aa9e21e024db2

commit_message:
Enable to associate ports with default fwg for non-admin users

This patch adds a privilege for non-admin users to associate ports with
default firewall group and fixes pep8 error.

    * Admin user can update except 'name' for default FWG
    * Non-admin user can update only 'ports' for default FWG

Change-Id: I32050e96637753da137297c4cf8caa565d6c8c9a

commit_message:
bgpvpn: agent extension support for local_pref

Use local_pref from OVO objects and pass it
to bagpipe-bgp attachments.

Change-Id: I9097454c45bd6441b6059e5a0d04ff891c14166b
Partially-Implements: blueprint routes-control

commit_message:
Switch baremetal nics/ports tests over

Moved baremetal port tests to a separate file and
updated them to utilize the new testing method.

Additionally, normalized the output of the port lists as
noise is introduced that is not needed.

Change-Id: I60492cca893e823cb2f9937405c75e23cc42807d

subject: Allow grant_role to select users outside default domain
messages:
[{'account_id': 2, 'date': '2017-12-04 19:02:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 170, 'date': '2017-12-04 22:36:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14119, 'date': '2017-12-09 17:44:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

So i worked on this a while back. The issue you get into with doing this is the role_grant stuff wasn't written to really lookup users and projects all over the place. If you want to pass by name, everything needs to be in the same domain. What you have here doesn't fix the same issue for the project lookup.

What I do in the upstream shade saltstack modules is collect all the user/project/domain/group objects ahead of time[0] and pass those into this function. There is even a note about needing to do that[1]

So i would suggest we flesh this out properly like my previous patchset[2], complete with user_domain project_domain group_domain options, or leave it alone entirely and tell people to pass id/objects into the function.

[0] https://github.com/saltstack/salt/blob/develop/salt/states/keystone_role_grant.py#L41-L94
[1] https://github.com/openstack/python-openstacksdk/blob/master/openstack/cloud/operatorcloud.py#L1822-L1825
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/496980/"}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2017-12-10 13:57:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-01-24 17:57:21.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Make heat parameter plugin_dirs configurable

Heat has an additional configuration for plugin_dirs
parameter. This parameter provides a list of directories
to search for plug-ins. This change allows configuration
of plugin_dirs parameter in heat.conf file. This change
will allow a user to set this value, if required. Else
$::os_service_default will be used and the parameter will
not be added to the config file, as it is done today.

Change-Id: I636d52f867ee447eaf0e1e80bf9fdc30c91f4ec1

commit_message:
Fix doc enforcer module for python3

itertools.ifilterfalse is itertools.filterfalse in python3. Just use a
list comprehension, the list isn't so big that we need to deal with
that. While we're in there, fix flake8.

Change-Id: Ic641516841c831f56f84c8a358fed4e8b47c157c

commit_message:
Fixing OVS driver coexistence check

Adding check to make sure that FWaaS v2 OVS driver
starts in coexistence mode only when SecurityGroup
is also setup with OVS driver

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-24 11:49:14.000000000', 'message': "Retrieve root password from leaderdb if needed

Within update_root_password if there is no root password in the
config() object then cfg['root-password'] will return None.
set_mysql_root_password is then called with None which triggers a
TypeError. The desired root password is in the leaderdb so fallback
to retrieving it from there if it is not in config().

unit_tests/test_utils.py was also updated to fix the behaviour of
config.changed to mimic that of the real method in charm helpers.

Change-Id: I8d22a66f335c0c8e893cda699a55056476e6d9d5
"}]
commit_message:
Retrieve root password from leaderdb if needed

Within update_root_password if there is no root password in the
config() object then cfg['root-password'] will return None.
set_mysql_root_password is then called with None which triggers a
TypeError. The desired root password is in the leaderdb so fallback
to retrieving it from there if it is not in config().

unit_tests/test_utils.py was also updated to fix the behaviour of
config.changed to mimic that of the real method in charm helpers.

Change-Id: I8d22a66f335c0c8e893cda699a55056476e6d9d5

commit_message:
Updates the Octavia cookbook to use OSC commands

This patch updates the Octavia basic cookbook to use the python-octaviaclient
commands via the OpenStack client as opposed to the deprecated neutron client.

Change-Id: I5a2d4cd2901880cc13f78646a5182cf93c31eb49

commit_message:
Sync charm-helpers

Notable issues resolved:

openstack_upgrade_available() broken for swift
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-swift-proxy/+bug/1743847

haproxy context doesn't consider bindings
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-helpers/+bug/1735421

regression in haproxy check
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-helpers/+bug/1743287

* Zesty is EOL

Change-Id: Iba2f51e0cf1b8daefbfd89bfaba9adcba679341c

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 22255, 'date': '2018-01-22 02:36:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27558, 'date': '2018-01-22 02:47:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2018-01-23 20:22:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

(14 comments)

Thanks Julia. Is 'negotiation' the standard terminology for this? (I am worried that people will think I am bike-shedding, but we're adding methods/properties in the library that are exposed to developers.)"}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-01-24 14:21:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(8 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2018-01-24 15:54:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2018-01-24 16:05:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

I have some concerns that I'm not totally convinced have been alleviated. However, we seem short on core reviewers and this is needed. I hope we haven't made a mistake by using 'negotiate' in the new properties/methods. In my mind, it isn't a negotiation, the client decides the max supported version based on asking the server for the min/max, its max, and the user's specified (if any) version. Anyway, if that is the common understanding/term used, so be it.

From [1], Negotiation is a dialogue between two or more people or parties intended to reach a beneficial outcome over one or more issues where a conflict exists with respect to at least one of these issues. This beneficial outcome can be for all of the parties involved, or just for one or some of them.

[1] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Negotiation"}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-01-24 16:32:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Workflow+1

I'd prefer we move forward with this, as this is quite important for consumption of the library. Please address nits in a follow-up."}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2018-01-24 16:54:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

For anyone else looking at this and the raison etre, this API guideline that Dmitry proposed, helps: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/532814/5'}]

commit_message:
Facilitate latest Rest API use

In order to provide insight into the remote
API verison, we need the ability to negotiate
upon the latest API version available, and then
report what that version is.

In order to understand if this has occured,
we also need to provide insight into if version
negotiation has occured.

Adds logic to the session/http clients to faciltate
version negotiation on the latest available version,
and provide user insight into that verison.

Change-Id: I813237eee4b122211f95558f677b25e0675569d5
Related-Bug: #1739440
Related-Bug: #1671145

commit_message:
Add Zuul v3 native midonet cross test

Migrate over legacy-cross-networking-midonet-python35 and convert it to
Zuul v3 native.

Allow .zuul.yaml to be edited, update .gitignore for this.

Change-Id: Icdf5bf8a4a023d4d7a3c12dda3a47cfe4b83b8f3
Needed-By: Ie1040995a66ad7df43b0be48d0ca01e358d06ad4

commit_message:
Remove deprecated ssl options

Old deprecated ssl options block the new keystoneauth parser get the
correct value, should be removed.

Change-Id: Ie080f9a8fa7f4407b1fcbb7fb7c763152c5ec295
Closes-Bug: 1697163

commit_message:
Add scope_types to domain policies

Since domains are always the root of a project tree, it makes sense
for them to be system-level APIs. It shouldn't be possible for a
domain administrator to create domains underneath their domain.

Change-Id: I1a5aa151b3f3d7af14399d5af2106937a69629f9

commit_message:
Fix api exception with unicode tenant name.

There are a lot request debug logging in Trove, when some values of
headers are encoded in utf8, UnicodeEncodeError will be raised by
webob.Request. Override how webob.Request is represented will fix.

Closes-Bug: #1720121

Change-Id: I91683b8dd24262b0f643e8d2bc7886a7c03be40a

commit_message:
heat-base: remove default policy rules

... the rule:context_is_admin is now managed in policy-in-code, in Heat:
https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/heat/tree/heat/policies/base.py#n25

Furthermore, the policy.json file management was removed with:
https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/11102/

Change-Id: Ibb2b7fa8750070fb338d04482a473a2bb3a2ea80
(cherry picked from commit c54b1b6169a8c4270068d14f7f9d270f2b563051)

commit_message:
Move Generic Backup Spec to Rocky

It has been discussed that this spec won't
make Queens but is planned for the Rocky
release, so I am moving the spec to that
directory.

commit_message:
Initial OSA zuul v3 role jobs

This patch implements an initial set of jobs intended to match
the current job execution method. It does not intend to improve
how the jobs are executed - only to replicate what is currently
in openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs and provide the platform
to iterate on.

Change-Id: I8a5a1c9278c52668b8d189a11cae593499bcd1c4

commit_message:
i18n: Do not include html directives in translation strings

It is important not to include html directives in translation targets
to avoid unnecessary errors when selecting translated languages.

You can check extracted strings by the following command locally:
  python manage.py extract_messages -m octavia_dashboard

Change-Id: Icb565d43efcb7b078ca0dab106de178ed7993457

[{'created': '2018-01-22 16:21:54.000000000', 'message': "Less opinionated detection of service env files

This should support OOOQ while hopefully not damaging Infrared
integration. We need to specifically look for the env files that match
the patterns we want, and we also need to support multiple env files
on a single line, because that's how OOOQ passes them in.

This solution should work both for the transformed and untransformed
deployment commands.

commit_message:
Less opinionated detection of service env files

This should support OOOQ while hopefully not damaging Infrared
integration. We need to specifically look for the env files that match
the patterns we want, and we also need to support multiple env files
on a single line, because that's how OOOQ passes them in.

This solution should work both for the transformed and untransformed
deployment commands.

Co-Authored-By: Jose Luis Franco <jfrancoa@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I4164ef552c333d6b9672c1a3d55c15a1b76e7bb7

Add healthcheck script for Redis

This patch adds script for docker health check of Redis service.
The script checks the service using RESP PING command.

commit_message:
Don't run check-tripleo OVB jobs frm RH1 anymore

Jobs now run in RDO CI, we don't need RH1 cloud to run OVB jobs anymore.
We'll keep experimental jobs until a complete decomission.

Related-Bug: #1744763
Change-Id: I25dcc22563316e184577822609aa7457da1c1d12
(cherry picked from commit 360ed77a0fcb4d7fa402991a706764e483ec3f2d)

commit_message:
Don't run check-tripleo OVB jobs frm RH1 anymore

Jobs now run in RDO CI, we don't need RH1 cloud to run OVB jobs anymore.
We'll keep experimental jobs until a complete decomission.

Related-Bug: #1744763
Change-Id: I25dcc22563316e184577822609aa7457da1c1d12
(cherry picked from commit 360ed77a0fcb4d7fa402991a706764e483ec3f2d)

commit_message:
Add CRUD support for application credentials

Add support for creating, reading, and deleting application credentials.
Application credentials do not support updating.

Keystoneclient does not handle authentication with application
credentials. This is done in keystoneauth. Additional work will be
needed in python-openstackclient to support both CRUD and auth for
application credentials.

bp application credentials

Change-Id: I21214238deac2c45f2f2d666287c2ae106955ab1

commit_message:
Make meta.find_best_address() more generic

This function now can choose address family with socket.getaddrinfo()
method and there is no need to pass address family as argument to it.

Change-Id: I72b1c1263876f2d047e5e540b72f2550ec73b65c
Story: 2001475
Task: 6213
(cherry picked from commit c4067e3baf7b14d687c6ab6aafd43c291f138091)

role assignments from python-keystoneclient.

Add domain specific driver support

This patch set allows for domain specific driver (ldap and sql)
for keystone.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-11 17:21:30.000000000', 'message': 'Add public binding to support DNS-HA.

This binding is required so that the DNS-HA code can find the
address to use for the hostname specified by os-public-hostname.

This also deprecates the os-internal-hostname and os-admin-hostname
options, as there is no binding to use them with.

Change-Id: I57609c5ab641e2ae6377c6fbad5c9e7b8cf6495c
Closes-Bug: #1742548
'}]
commit_message:
Add public binding to support DNS-HA.

This binding is required so that the DNS-HA code can find the
address to use for the hostname specified by os-public-hostname.

This also deprecates the os-internal-hostname and os-admin-hostname
options, as there is no binding to use them with.

Change-Id: I57609c5ab641e2ae6377c6fbad5c9e7b8cf6495c
Closes-Bug: #1742548

commit_message:
Don't run check-tripleo OVB jobs frm RH1 anymore

Jobs now run in RDO CI, we don't need RH1 cloud to run OVB jobs anymore.
We'll keep experimental jobs until a complete decomission.

Related-Bug: #1744763
Change-Id: I25dcc22563316e184577822609aa7457da1c1d12
(cherry picked from commit 360ed77a0fcb4d7fa402991a706764e483ec3f2d)

commit_message:
Add --tag-from-label to prepare command

This will cause tag discovery to be performed on every image entry
during a prepare run.

Change-Id: Ibf6a63f9e145989b5caa8365833980b29a193251
Closes-Bug: #1738669

commit_message:
heat-base: remove default policy rules

... the rule:context_is_admin is now managed in policy-in-code, in Heat:
https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/heat/tree/heat/policies/base.py#n25

Furthermore, the policy.json file management was removed with:
https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/11102/

Change-Id: Ibb2b7fa8750070fb338d04482a473a2bb3a2ea80

commit_message:
Remove httpd log dir for glance-api

Glance API still runs eventlet, the
/var/log/containers/httpd/glance-api directory on the host serves no
purpose and confuses users. Remove it.

Change-Id: Idcd26571d20f02b723af9938ba625c9fa548c0d7
Closes-Bug: #1728562
(cherry picked from commit 0f55e3a162e5678990df9556eef5c3ee1e089627)

commit_message:
Sync charm-helpers

Notable issues resolved:

openstack_upgrade_available() broken for swift
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-swift-proxy/+bug/1743847

haproxy context doesn't consider bindings
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-helpers/+bug/1735421

regression in haproxy check
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-helpers/+bug/1743287

* Zesty is EOL

Change-Id: Ibbaab2c4ed674c8d71fcde234d6f739b1058aebd
