Matt,

thanks for review and update, lgtm.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-01-23 15:50:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-01-24 14:14:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7166, 'date': '2018-01-24 14:42:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-20 16:32:40.000000000', 'message': 'Address comments from original inventory patch

This addresses some comments from change
Ie46b6217fda65cb5d0f1379d0b4a986b4c30a3eb:

1. Fixes a typo in the resource class help.

2. Makes the 'total' inventory field required to avoid
   ugly error output if total is not specified with
   "openstack resource provider inventory class set".

3. Adds more wording to the "openstack resource provider inventory set"
   CLI description about how inventory fields are parsed and that it
   is a full replacement of the inventory, not just amending existing
   inventory.

Part of blueprint placement-osc-plugin

Change-Id: I8c6f3387dba891d5c6aea617594a6ef682ada62d
'}, {'created': '2018-01-23 15:50:29.000000000', 'message': 'Address comments from original inventory patch

This addresses some comments from change
Ie46b6217fda65cb5d0f1379d0b4a986b4c30a3eb:

1. Fixes a typo in the resource class help.

2. Makes the 'total' inventory field required to avoid
   ugly error output if total is not specified with
   "openstack resource provider inventory class set".

3. Adds more wording to the "openstack resource provider inventory set"
   CLI description about how inventory fields are parsed and that it
   is a full replacement of the inventory, not just amending existing
   inventory.

Part of blueprint placement-osc-plugin

Change-Id: I8c6f3387dba891d5c6aea617594a6ef682ada62d
'}]
commit_message:
Address comments from original inventory patch

This addresses some comments from change
Ie46b6217fda65cb5d0f1379d0b4a986b4c30a3eb:

1. Fixes a typo in the resource class help.

2. Makes the 'total' inventory field required to avoid
   ugly error output if total is not specified with
   "openstack resource provider inventory class set".

3. Adds more wording to the "openstack resource provider inventory set"
   CLI description about how inventory fields are parsed and that it
   is a full replacement of the inventory, not just amending existing
   inventory.

Part of blueprint placement-osc-plugin

Change-Id: I8c6f3387dba891d5c6aea617594a6ef682ada62d

Workflows triggered from deploy-steps.j2 were not honoring the
blacklist, particularly ceph-ansible. This patch starts to address that
issue by passing in a list of blacklisted ip addresses to the workflow
execution environment that the workflow can make use of to filter
against ctlplane_service_ips.

Change-Id: Ic158171c629e82892e480f1e6903a67457f86064

commit_message:
Workflow execution blacklist support

Workflows triggered from deploy-steps.j2 were not honoring the
blacklist, particularly ceph-ansible. This patch starts to address that
issue by passing in a list of blacklisted ip addresses to the workflow
execution environment that the workflow can make use of to filter
against ctlplane_service_ips.

Change-Id: Ic158171c629e82892e480f1e6903a67457f86064
Partial-Bug: #1743046
(cherry picked from commit 79570ed2b91dbfc256397f0c64a560e4ea4b7589)

commit_message:
Remove use of deprecated config 'resources_prefix'

Tempest has removed this deprecated config option [1].
Alough manila-tempest-plugin was prepared for this change
via [2], stable/pike still uses the in tree tempest tests
and is broken.

Port the oneline change from manila-tempest-plugin back
to stable/pike intree tempest tests.

[1] Idce7af97fe6647e3095b2b626fbacb3446694fbc

[2] Ia65b9c8de0bb4abef040ddf0f2f7dd2f3779dcd7

Change-Id: I8a94dc1a3ba61ec4716f6407ab8a2703a11c75c2

commit_message:
Sync charm-helpers

Notable issues resolved:

openstack_upgrade_available() broken for swift
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-swift-proxy/+bug/1743847

haproxy context doesn't consider bindings
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-helpers/+bug/1735421

regression in haproxy check
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-helpers/+bug/1743287

This change also breaks the inheritance between
HorizonHAProxyContext and HAProxyContext (as this was
not needed) and aligns the code in HorizonHAProxyContext
to the behaviour in HAProxyContext of using get_relation_ip
instead of unit_get.

* Zesty is EOL

Change-Id: Ie059e86a152f6e2cc6e65af4fce1b83dcc3115e0

commit_message:
Add zone migration strategy

This patch adds hardware maintenance goal, efficacy and zone
migration strategy.

Change-Id: I5bfee421780233ffeea8c1539aba720ae554983d
Implements: blueprint zone-migration-strategy

commit_message:
Strategy requirements

This patch set adds /state resource to strategy API
which allows to retrieve strategy requirements.

Partially-Implements: blueprint check-strategy-requirements
Change-Id: I177b443648301eb50da0da63271ecbfd9408bd4f

commit_message:
Sync charm-helpers

Notable issues resolved:

openstack_upgrade_available() broken for swift
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-swift-proxy/+bug/1743847

haproxy context doesn't consider bindings
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-helpers/+bug/1735421

regression in haproxy check
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-helpers/+bug/1743287

* Zesty is EOL

Change-Id: I8796449a75859e10b98e6ba4ce70745bdb77c0c3

commit_message:
Remove use of unsupported TEMPEST_SERVICES variable

TEMPEST_SERVICES global variable is not supported
by devstack since long back.
- I380dd20e5ed716a0bdf92aa02c3730359b8136e4
- I9c24705e494689f09a885eb0a640efd50db33fcf

Service availability of tempest known services will be
set by devstack with local check.
- I02be777bf93143d946ccbb8e9eff637bfd1928d4

This commit removes the unused TEMPEST_SERVICES setting
Related-Bug: #1743688

Change-Id: Ie4e5abee05500ba5c9a9cc7408705c3940c92c7b

subject: Revert refresh_token method
messages:
[{'account_id': 17981, 'date': '2018-01-22 02:27:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17981, 'date': '2018-01-22 04:31:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

`_init_client` has weak "internal use" indicator, so is it better to change as followings?

1. Remove `_` from this method
2. Call `get_token` instead of `_init_client`
3. Create `refresh_token` method ad below
```
def refresh_token(self):
  """Gets a new keystone client object and token
  This method should be called if the token has expired
  """
  return self._init_client()

commit_message:
Revert refresh_token method

This commit reverts refresh_token method from
commit b71fd4bef46f6a343c9f9f711e959f5f62a98a0e.

This method is used in http_check.

Story: 2001493

commit_message:
Migrate oneview hardware type to use python-hpOneView

Migrate the code on ``oneview`` hardware type to stop using
``python-oneviewclient`` in order to use ``python-hpOneView``
and ``python-ilorest-library``. The library ``python-hpOneView``
is more recent and is being more actively developed and maintained.

Co-Authored-By: Hugo Nicodemos <nicodemos@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Xavier <marcusrafael@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

Change-Id: I2c5b1703603b1401be637b6172cc4297f705332f
Partial-Bug: #1693788

commit_message:
Fix workload_stabilization unavailable nodes and instances

This patch set excludes nodes and instances from auditing
if appropriate metrics aren't available.

Change-Id: I87c6c249e3962f45d082f92d7e6e0be04e101799
Closes-Bug: #1736982
(cherry picked from commit 701b258dc76cd989e902efc2b507642359d1bfd7)

commit_message:
Support policy.yaml file [part 8]

- Horizon

This will copy only yaml or json policy file if they exist.

Change-Id: Ib8875ca54dc9dc69abc8338413f7724d9d4ecc45
Implements: blueprint support-custom-policy-yaml
Co-authored-By: Duong Ha-Quang <duonghq@vn.fujitsu.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-23 15:43:42.000000000', 'message': "Fix column rename migration for mariadb 10.2

MariaDB 10.2 introduced an issue where an automatic check constraint is
applied to boolean columns and is not automatically updated on a column
rename alter operation[1]. A similar issue preventing dropping such a
column was already fixed[2], so this patch changes the migration to drop
and readd the column instead of attempting a column rename.

Unfortunately since the mistake was already made, it is possible for
deployments out in the wild to have made it past the expand step and be
currently stuck in the contract step. To accomodate them, we add the new
column as part of the contract step if necessary. Again, since there
should be no data in this table, we don't need to worry about online
upgrades here.

[1] https://jira.mariadb.org/browse/MDEV-13508
[2] https://jira.mariadb.org/browse/MDEV-11114

Change-Id: Icbd58464182b082854fb5d73ccc93c900ede020c
Closes-bug: #1744948
"}]
commit_message:
Fix column rename migration for mariadb 10.2

MariaDB 10.2 introduced an issue where an automatic check constraint is
applied to boolean columns and is not automatically updated on a column
rename alter operation[1]. A similar issue preventing dropping such a
column was already fixed[2], so this patch changes the migration to drop
and readd the column instead of attempting a column rename.

Unfortunately since the mistake was already made, it is possible for
deployments out in the wild to have made it past the expand step and be
currently stuck in the contract step. To accomodate them, we add the new
column as part of the contract step if necessary. Again, since there
should be no data in this table, we don't need to worry about online
upgrades here.

[1] https://jira.mariadb.org/browse/MDEV-13508
[2] https://jira.mariadb.org/browse/MDEV-11114

Change-Id: Icbd58464182b082854fb5d73ccc93c900ede020c
Closes-bug: #1744948

commit_message:
Bump timeout for unit test jobs

We experience slowdowns for all types of unit test jobs (py27, py35,
cover) in neutron, for all branches (ocata, pike, master).

This patch bumps timeouts for all those jobs by another 10m, that
should give enough space for the jobs.

Full disclosure: timeout for cover job was already bumped lately, in Dec
2017, as part of Id1e1b5fd88649a3af460f4a8a3f4da51c350cbec.

Closes-Bug: #1744363
Closes-Bug: #1744983

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-23 20:22:35.000000000', 'message': 'SUSE: Switch to upstream MariaDB repository

The OBS development repository was proven to be quite fragile since
the mariadb packages were moving far to quickly. Whilst this has helped
to catch bugs when OpenStack services were used against newer MariaDB
versions, it also created a very unstable infrastructure for openSUSE
deployments. As such, we have now switched to using the upstream SLE
packages as provided by MariaDB upstream so all distributions are
aligned to how they deploy the Galera clusters. This further allow us
to report upstream bugs which fix problems across all distributions.

Change-Id: Ic88c55fd551f3d1666b9bbfd57040fe8fedaa990
'}]
commit_message:
SUSE: Switch to upstream MariaDB repository

The OBS development repository was proven to be quite fragile since
the mariadb packages were moving far to quickly. Whilst this has helped
to catch bugs when OpenStack services were used against newer MariaDB
versions, it also created a very unstable infrastructure for openSUSE
deployments. As such, we have now switched to using the upstream SLE
packages as provided by MariaDB upstream so all distributions are
aligned to how they deploy the Galera clusters. This further allow us
to report upstream bugs which fix problems across all distributions.

Change-Id: Ic88c55fd551f3d1666b9bbfd57040fe8fedaa990

commit_message:
Make sure, the realtime element removes the default kernel

Since the default kernel is a protected package, removing it, even in
the chroot environment, may fail. This fix forces the removal by
disabling the protected_packages configuration.

Change-Id: Ib7c849cf6aa2b1716cfddfe6e852dae482e00301

commit_message:
Add rgw_keystone_implicit_tenants to ceph-ansible/ceph-base.yaml

This patch adds rgw_keystone_implicit_tenants to the ceph-base.yaml
file. Setting this parameter to true creates a new tenant per user.
This patch resolves BZ1481819 for ceph-ansible deployments.

Change-Id: I4f4688bbdc79c33ccf697813adb5ef26eca79e6b

commit_message:
Add missing support for the root_device property

Our documentation requires it to be set for multi-disk nodes, but it's
not accepted in instackenv.json. This patch fixes it.

As a side fix, property values are no longer converted to strings. This
has never been required, and may potentially yield incorrect results
(like with root_device, which is a dictionary).

Change-Id: I4e9fbc940c424071206e96b3d90086282f381a9f
Closes-Bug: #1742905

commit_message:
Parameterize Ansible environment vars in Mistral Workflow

Add ansible_env_variables which a user may use to override
any Ansible environment variable. This new parameter is
then merged with the default env variables as set in
ansible_extra_env_variables.

Also adds DEFAULT_FORKS to the default env variables
with a new default of 50. Ansible automatically limits
the number of forks to the number of possible hosts at
runtime so it is not necessary to compute the fork count.

Change-Id: I5d69af146ca6ca8b3d5f78445cd1b47828daa955
Partial-Bug: 1738276
(cherry picked from commit 97185448b307cea98a2e2f11337df4950e76b95d)

Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Add extra options for undercloud deploy command

To alleviate missing flexibility ( like proposed in
I6d61dee8c19f708bc834a497593122f23ef2baf4 ) for the experimental
undercloud deploy CLI options passed via quickstart inventory
vars, allow to specify:

* The client's --local-domain via undercloud_cloud_domain
  (unset by default)
* Additional services environments files. Defaults to those
  currently hardcoded. The hadcoded values go away as well.

Change-Id: I706d3386288fa4c9086294ec5bcdb746c539ca37
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fixes generating public certificates

In non-containerized deployments auto-generation of public certificates
fails because the parameter for determining autogeneration is only used
in the docker haproxy service template.  This patch adds it also to the
puppet service.

Closes-Bug: 1742481

Change-Id: I4c6e2e95ee9e24973f4d2943d250ca5314493b3c
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 7be65d2666e90837d0ed35bdf4933d2ae0881d5a)

commit_message:
Move parameter to parameter_defaults section

The parameter PublicSSLCertificateAutogenerated was added in
resource_registry section in environment file in change
I299e6052e6a872c3907184b635d218a806d906e0, moving it to
parameter_defaults section.

Change-Id: Ib454a080c910e2cd2dae22a11d04794824dcb9ad
Closes-Bug: 1731480
(cherry picked from commit ce7d8e36deac856f6bfad14d94fe2fb44c21c23f)

commit_message:
Always pass the plan name to fernet workbook

It was using the default (overcloud) which is not necessarily the case
for every deployment.

This commit passes the TRIPLEO_PLAN_NAME environment file and derives
the value from the passed container name.

Change-Id: I2fc481336b945c88f8b6a017690773be3293a2b4
Closes-Bug: #1742655
(cherry picked from commit 49cb3b2e052bda379d35c6141874a332e983fa8c)

commit_message:
Configure RDO cloud jobs to send stats to InfluxDB

Configure all RDO cloud jobs to send statistics from ARA to
InfluxDB server in RDo cloud.

Depends-On: I50da9da53a702982f53d148b9851657612f237e5
Change-Id: I97504da321a70837756265ada74ce52354a58f08

So before moving on with the reviews here, how much do we care about quality of the code vs. we just want for this to just work ? Because I'll keep -1 until SCHEME is a class, there is no way I can approve using a big dictionary with inline functions that fill the data, then templating everything from the SCHEME dict. This will probably become unreadable very soon, and I would like to be able to fix bugs when things break."}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2018-01-17 16:57:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 12715, 'date': '2018-01-17 19:49:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10022, 'date': '2018-01-18 11:26:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

commit_message:
Ignore node_modules from test target

Files in node_modules directory are not target for test.
So we should ignore them.

Change-Id: I3b259c7df21660e61fcb55633c82bdd83d791a3d

subject: Imported Translations from Zanata
messages:
[{'account_id': 4978, 'date': '2018-01-19 10:06:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

There's a lot of "empty" translations that seem to overwrite valid ones - we've just had some Zanata issues on the master branch so checking with i18n before merging.'}, {'account_id': 4978, 'date': '2018-01-22 09:36:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I don't recall this many "empty" strings before, I want to test to see if it means the user just sees nothing at all written or if the English string will get picked up. Not sure if something else changed in the background (deps update?)'}, {'account_id': 4978, 'date': '2018-01-24 12:00:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

Quick testing shows that the string does get displayed in English when it's only set as an empty string in the translation files. I guess we're good to go and hopefully Zanata will still highlight these as needing a translation, for later :)"}]

commit_message:
Migrates ceph-{radosgw,mds,rbdmirror} to ceph-ansible

Previously these environment files were pointing to a version of
the services implemented using puppet-ceph, now they are migrated
to using ceph-ansible.

Change-Id: I159e2e9408dc5749ec0c287ef06aa0b1421b7d88
Closes-Bug: 1744714

commit_message:
Discover nova hosts in cells right before deployment

This is required by nova to be able to use new ironic nodes. Currently,
we run it after each enroll. However, it does not get run for nodes
that are auto-discovered or enrolled manually. Doing another run
right before deployment guarantees that all nodes are known to nova.

Conflicts:
	workbooks/deployment.yaml

Change-Id: I7adb12800d5107b041689a5eaeed882b3695291b
Closes-Bug: #1742179
(cherry picked from commit 09e70b4b2c34abd83a73bb1a1c85c3c3b8449706)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-23 22:01:17.000000000', 'message': "Correct location of venv build logs

In [1] the intent was to have each venv build log
to its own log file. This makes troubleshooting a
lot easier due to the verbosity of the output in
the log - this at least separates each venv's
output. Unfortunately this extra CLI option was
supposed to be removed. This patch completes the
original intent.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/470757

Change-Id: I714d160a39beb870ba66db11a60cf0241ca770f3
"}]
commit_message:
Correct location of venv build logs

In [1] the intent was to have each venv build log
to its own log file. This makes troubleshooting a
lot easier due to the verbosity of the output in
the log - this at least separates each venv's
output. Unfortunately this extra CLI option was
supposed to be removed. This patch completes the
original intent.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/470757

Change-Id: I714d160a39beb870ba66db11a60cf0241ca770f3

commit_message:
Fix workload_stabilization unavailable nodes and instances

This patch set excludes nodes and instances from auditing
if appropriate metrics aren't available.

Change-Id: I87c6c249e3962f45d082f92d7e6e0be04e101799
Closes-Bug: #1736982

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-09 17:24:48.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Add RPC object for traits

Also looks at adding traits into the node object.

Change-Id: I69403b9875a020fab7a7975810b57bf646417953
Partial-Bug: #1722194
'}, {'created': '2018-01-09 19:55:43.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Add RPC object for traits

Also looks at adding traits into the node object, but this currently is
going badly, in part due to lazy loading of traits on a now orphaned db
object. Seems to be a big problem on create.

Change-Id: I69403b9875a020fab7a7975810b57bf646417953
Partial-Bug: #1722194
'}, {'created': '2018-01-10 17:19:42.000000000', 'message': 'Add RPC object for traits

Adds a new traits object to expose traits DB operations to the API. It
also adds a new traits field into the node object, with the appropriate
version compatibility logic.

The main risk here appears to be a problem with attempting to lazy load
the traits attribute. All db objects are orphaned, so the lazy load
fails, but all routes should be correctly joining. There was an IP
lookup route that was missed previously and added in this patch.

TODO: missing a few tests for the code added in here.

Change-Id: I69403b9875a020fab7a7975810b57bf646417953
Partial-Bug: #1722194
'}, {'created': '2018-01-10 18:25:09.000000000', 'message': "Add RPC object for traits

Adds a new traits object to expose traits DB operations to the API. It
also adds a new traits field into the node object, with the appropriate
version compatibility logic.

Note that Node save and create now re-query the node from the DB so the
correct join of the traits and tags table occurs, so the object can
correctly load from the db object without hitting an orphaned db
object lazy load failure.

get_node_by_port_addresses is modified to ensure we correctly join in
the tags and traits in that DB call, this avoids a orphaned db object
lazy load style failure.

_set_from_db_object in the base object is modified such that the new
traits object doesn't have to include the dictionary style compatibility
mix-in.

Change-Id: I69403b9875a020fab7a7975810b57bf646417953
Partial-Bug: #1722194
"}, {'created': '2018-01-11 12:22:14.000000000', 'message': "Add RPC object for traits

Adds a new traits object to expose traits DB operations to the API. It
also adds a new traits field into the node object, with the appropriate
version compatibility logic.

Note that Node save and create now re-query the node from the DB so the
correct join of the traits and tags table occurs, so the object can
correctly load from the db object without hitting an orphaned db
object lazy load failure.

get_node_by_port_addresses is modified to ensure we correctly join in
the tags and traits in that DB call, this avoids a orphaned db object
lazy load style failure.

_set_from_db_object in the base object is modified such that the new
traits object doesn't have to include the dictionary style compatibility
mix-in.

Change-Id: I69403b9875a020fab7a7975810b57bf646417953
Partial-Bug: #1722194
"}, {'created': '2018-01-12 14:31:51.000000000', 'message': "Add RPC object for traits

Adds a new traits object to expose traits DB operations to the API. It
also adds a new traits field into the node object, with the appropriate
version compatibility logic.

Note that Node save and create now re-query the node from the DB so the
correct join of the traits and tags table occurs, so the object can
correctly load from the db object without hitting an orphaned db
object lazy load failure.

get_node_by_port_addresses is modified to ensure we correctly join in
the tags and traits in that DB call, this avoids a orphaned db object
lazy load style failure.

_set_from_db_object in the base object is modified such that the new
traits object doesn't have to include the dictionary style compatibility
mix-in.

Change-Id: I69403b9875a020fab7a7975810b57bf646417953
Partial-Bug: #1722194

commit_message:
Add RPC object for traits

Adds a new traits object to expose traits DB operations to the API. It
also adds a new traits field into the node object, with the appropriate
version compatibility logic.

get_node_by_port_addresses is modified to ensure we correctly join in
the tags and traits in that DB call, this avoids a orphaned db object
lazy load style failure.

_set_from_db_object in the base object is modified such that the new
traits object doesn't have to include the dictionary style compatibility
mix-in.

Change-Id: I69403b9875a020fab7a7975810b57bf646417953
Partial-Bug: #1722194
Co-Authored-By: Mark Goddard <mark@stackhpc.com>

commit_message:
Update LRP when a router port is updated

Right now when a router port is updated, the corresponding
Logical Router Port is not updated. This patch checks if the
port to be updated is a LRP and updates it accordingly.

Also, I'm removing the router_id parameter in router_port_update
method since it was no longer used.

Closes-Bug: #1744087
Change-Id: I939f4c40a5e9e58c3a216353f03179578b81f64c

commit_message:
config: Provide a Keystone only overcloud config

This change introduces a simple general_config file that simply deploys
a Keystone only overcloud, useful in testing the upcoming Fast Forward
Upgrade feature for TripleO in Queens.

Change-Id: I426e797285082af220153ac09d6b011a05421cb6

subject: Add pipeline modification test for previously-recommended pipelines
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1179, 'name': 'Clay Gerrard', 'email': 'clay.gerrard@gmail.com', 'username': 'clay-gerrard'}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 7233, 'name': 'Matthew Oliver', 'email': 'matt@oliver.net.au', 'username': 'mattoliverau'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15343, 'name': 'Tim Burke', 'email': 'tburke@nvidia.com', 'username': 'tburke'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-01-09 23:56:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-01-10 00:00:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-01-10 00:10:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-01-10 00:12:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

If anyone else wants to generate a list of previously-recommended pipelines, I used

 for v in `git tag | sed -e '/^[0-9][0-9]*\.[0-9][0-9]*\.[0-9][0-9]*$/!d' | sort -V`; do echo -n "$v " ; git show $v:etc/proxy-server.conf-sample | grep '^pipeline =' || echo ; done | uniq -c -f 1 | sed -e 's/pipeline = //; s/ proxy-server//''}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-01-10 00:12:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2018-01-10 22:27:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

cool test bro!'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-01-10 22:42:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

recheck

I don't know what Zuul's on about... this is directly on tip of master"}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2018-01-10 23:10:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

zuul's being rebooted so probably just a side effect.

Looks great though, love the bash command you used.. we'll need to save that so we can keep updating this test on each new release. Maybe a tool in the test structure or a comment?"}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-01-23 22:16:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Add pipeline modification test for previously-recommended pipelines

This includes every pipeline from etc/proxy-server.conf-sample since we
switched from swauth to tempauth in 1.4.1. As much as anything, I view
this as a canary for auto-insertion changes, so we can (somewhat easily)
see where new middlewares will be placed when upgrading from old swifts.

Change-Id: I117937ab6ce28f3bc219e809f07b563c45fc486f
Related-Change: I88678fddc7a25b0f065b33eb26047321d0db4d38

subject: Removes unicode response for "cinder get-capabilities"
messages:
[{'account_id': 27311, 'date': '2018-01-18 21:26:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-01-18 21:26:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 27311, 'date': '2018-01-19 03:41:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2018-01-19 15:32:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2

I don't understand why you are making another patch here instead of just updating the original.  Can you please do that instead?"}, {'account_id': 27311, 'date': '2018-01-20 19:28:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> I don't understand why you are making another patch here instead of
 > just updating the original.  Can you please do that instead?

Sorry, I am a newbie to Gerrit review process and I got to know later that I could use the same commit point of the different owner from Gerrit to continue patching. Will improvise :).  Please check I have submitted the patch for original review."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-01-23 11:26:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

This patch should be abandoned.'}, {'account_id': 27311, 'date': '2018-01-23 16:44:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

Sure, will abandon it.'}, {'account_id': 27311, 'date': '2018-01-24 11:13:46.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Removes unicode response for "cinder get-capabilities"

This is a patch for existing change referred at https://review.openstack.org/454159,
Added formatters=sorted(prop.keys()) as suggested by the reviewer, to avoid tying server
knowledge to the client and also any update on the server side would easily reflect here.

Fixed PEP8 style.

Closes-bug: #1680444

Change-Id: I31cfab9f647af5f2ef3363116cdd1adbad3b772a

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-23 21:44:17.000000000', 'message': "Fix traits in Node._convert_to_version when pinned

Fixes an issue with the Node object conversion when converting a node
with no traits field set to a version prior to 1.23. Previously, the
node's traits field would be accessed, leading to the following
exception:

NotImplementedError: Cannot load 'traits' in the base class

We fix this by avoiding the code path when the traits field is not set.

Change-Id: I038450d41edc2917d59f01ab42b92a87d61761eb
Partial-Bug: #1722194
"}]
commit_message:
Fix traits in Node._convert_to_version when pinned

Fixes an issue with the Node object conversion when converting a node
with no traits field set to a version prior to 1.23. Previously, the
node's traits field would be accessed, leading to the following
exception:

NotImplementedError: Cannot load 'traits' in the base class

We fix this by avoiding the code path when the traits field is not set.

Change-Id: I038450d41edc2917d59f01ab42b92a87d61761eb
Partial-Bug: #1722194

commit_message:
Specification to cover Keystone Federation support

This specification outlines an approach for adding support for
keystone to use external identity providers (idPs) via SAML or
OpenID.

Change-Id: Ic0ec3c0ae2ce1247e1684f9aca8a645f56d1a986

commit_message:
Add storage capacity balance Strategy

This patch adds Storage Capacity Balance Strategy to balance the
storage capacity through volume migration.

Change-Id: I52ea7ce00deb609a2f668db330f1fbc1c9932613
Implements: blueprint storage-workload-balance

subject: Properly match the LXC index item to download
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-01-23 22:13:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-01-24 02:10:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-01-24 09:34:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-01-24 09:37:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-23 22:13:35.000000000', 'message': "Properly match the LXC index item to download

Currently the match will return two results if the
variant to download is 'default' and the index
contains both 'default' and 'default-beta.1'. The
download task then downloads them both and the last
one wins.

This patch corrects the matching mechanism to ensure
that the match is properly delimited to prevent
improper matches.

This patch also ensures that only one download is done
if there are multiple matches. The list of results is
reverse sorted so that the most recent result is used.

Change-Id: I1086d41bd483d91d8d037a3ba8db4f92e738536e
(cherry picked from commit 45bee5806a4249eaf511f9203a50cbacca88b72f)
"}]
commit_message:
Properly match the LXC index item to download

Currently the match will return two results if the
variant to download is 'default' and the index
contains both 'default' and 'default-beta.1'. The
download task then downloads them both and the last
one wins.

This patch corrects the matching mechanism to ensure
that the match is properly delimited to prevent
improper matches.

This patch also ensures that only one download is done
if there are multiple matches. The list of results is
reverse sorted so that the most recent result is used.

Change-Id: I1086d41bd483d91d8d037a3ba8db4f92e738536e
(cherry picked from commit 45bee5806a4249eaf511f9203a50cbacca88b72f)

revisions:

commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: EVPN/VXLAN interop fix

We need to interpret the content of EVPN routes based on whether the
dataplane is VXLAN or not: if it is, then we need to read the raw value,
not the 4-bit shifted value that applies for an MPLS label.

Similarly in the routes we advertise, we must avoid 4-bit shifting the
VXLAN VNI value.

These changes require modification in ExaBGP encoding/decoding classes,
and result in requiring ExaBGP > 4.0.2 (unreleased yet) [1].

[1] https://github.com/Exa-Networks/exabgp/pull/744

Closes-Bug: 1732668
Change-Id: I3e73ed30dc2936820a50518a1d7a18d34f5a0e65

commit_message:
Sync charm-helpers

Notable issues resolved:

openstack_upgrade_available() broken for swift
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-swift-proxy/+bug/1743847

haproxy context doesn't consider bindings
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-helpers/+bug/1735421

regression in haproxy check
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-helpers/+bug/1743287

* Zesty is EOL

Change-Id: I1cabed3bfc2be09d2632ed06a84ee20ec5738484

(2 comments)

IMO, To avoid zuul check failure you need to break this patch in 3 patches:
Patch 1: create glance-image-import.conf file (all changes regarding new file will go in this patch, also you need to add sample file under etc directory as glance-image-import.conf and not as glance-image-import.conf.sample)

Patch 2: this should be submitted in devstack to copy glance-image-import.conf file to /etc/glance directory (similar to https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/master/lib/glance#L114)

Patch 3: Code to inject metadata properties.

Added minor nits here'}, {'account_id': 20182, 'date': '2017-12-14 12:39:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-12-14 12:45:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

This change depends on a change that failed to merge.'}, {'account_id': 20182, 'date': '2017-12-14 12:49:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-12-14 12:52:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

This change depends on a change that failed to merge.'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2017-12-14 16:36:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Hi Bhagyashri,

The functionality looks like a good start. There is couple of things we need to address about the implementation 'though before this meets the design points that were discussed when we agreed on the feature.

First this is tightly coupled to the api_image_impor taskflow and will execute on every import call regardless the configuration. it does not implement the hooks where these tasks can be plugged/unplugged to the flow as discussed during the design phase. What we really need to come up with is entrypoint for these new tasks to be loaded dynamically into the flow, not hardcoded into one specific taskflow. We need to have something that deployer can literally go and delete (or drop a new one and enable it) the file containing the task and glance will still run. There is no way with this implementation that the operator could prevent the property injection task being executed as part of the flow. This also means that the module needs to be self sufficient cotaining the config options within etc. instead of having all that tightly integrated to the rest of the glance codebase.

We need to be able to do this on all of the image import methods (that will be their own taskflows) from single source. I will try to find time by next week to come up with some kind of boiler plate how to do this (or if this really makes sense to you and you have an idea in mind how to do it, please feel free to ping me and propose the change to the approach)."}, {'account_id': 20182, 'date': '2017-12-15 12:21:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> Hi Bhagyashri,
 > 
 > The functionality looks like a good start. There is couple of
 > things we need to address about the implementation 'though before
 > this meets the design points that were discussed when we agreed on
 > the feature.
 > 
 > First this is tightly coupled to the api_image_impor taskflow and
 > will execute on every import call regardless the configuration. it
 > does not implement the hooks where these tasks can be
 > plugged/unplugged to the flow as discussed during the design phase.
 > What we really need to come up with is entrypoint for these new
 > tasks to be loaded dynamically into the flow, not hardcoded into
 > one specific taskflow. We need to have something that deployer can
 > literally go and delete (or drop a new one and enable it) the file
 > containing the task and glance will still run. There is no way with
 > this implementation that the operator could prevent the property
 > injection task being executed as part of the flow. This also means
 > that the module needs to be self sufficient cotaining the config
 > options within etc. instead of having all that tightly integrated
 > to the rest of the glance codebase.
 > 
 > We need to be able to do this on all of the image import methods
 > (that will be their own taskflows) from single source. I will try
 > to find time by next week to come up with some kind of boiler plate
 > how to do this (or if this really makes sense to you and you have
 > an idea in mind how to do it, please feel free to ping me and
 > propose the change to the approach).

Hi Erno, Thanks for review,

As per implementation the task "InjectImageMetadata" will only be execute when some property is set in glance-image-import.conf. If the property is empty (or property is not set in glance-image-import.conf inject option) then this task will not be execute. So this is not tightly coupled to the api_image_import taskflow and will not execute on every import call.'}, {'account_id': 20182, 'date': '2017-12-20 10:38:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2017-12-21 03:53:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(11 comments)'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2017-12-21 04:00:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2017-12-21 12:19:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

Thanks Bhagyashri,

This start to look more like it. Abhishek had some very valid comments there and added couple myself.

we're definitely going towards right direction with this."}, {'account_id': 20182, 'date': '2017-12-22 12:26:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2017-12-26 05:21:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Implementation of Inject metadata properties

Implements the spec Inject metadata properties automatically
to non-admin images

This commit adds new task '_InjectImageMetadata' to inject
the metadata properties automatically to non-admin images
at the time of creation of images using newly introduce
'image-import' api in v2.

DocImpact

Implements: I6a7ed31d5fae677cbbc9a6f6053f79d3e9326561
Change-Id: I98be97c42f23b60a72d520aad5f6078a96372c59
